Title: Travel Manager
Location: Qesm El Agoza, Al Jizah, Egypt
Description:
Egyliere is a luxury travel and lifestyle management company that creates bespoke, high-end experiences for affluent clients, offering services from private jet charters, hotel bookings, and VIP event access (like Fashion Week or sports) to personalized concierge support for seamless travel, visa management, and exclusive dining, all managed through their app for effortless planning and execution. Based in Egypt but serving a global clientele, Egyliere focuses on personalized luxury, ensuring every detail from flights to exclusive experiences exceeds expectations.
Specific tasks for this position will include but are not limited to:
• To build relationships with existing clients and to understand their business needs.
• To give well-informed, appropriate advice to clients about where and when to travel based on their needs.
• To handle operational activities related to outgoing and incoming travel activities.
• To handle and oversee entry visa applications.
• To manage the enquiry source with Egyliere Travel team and communicate with Marketing.
• To deal with complaints or refunds and follow up with clients to measure the quality of service provided.
• To contract and negotiate with all suppliers to achieve best services at least possible costs Producing the most innovative, creative, attractive and price-worthy proposals for all client requests.
• To partner, affiliate and represent small, medium and large luxury travel agencies and concierge companies in major cities worldwide. To be reviewed every three months. Acquire information from touristic statistics bureaus, fairs, and LinkedIn.
• To partner and affiliate with these same agencies and others to establish outbound destinations for the local market.
• To manage proposals, costs breakdown and all profit and cost margins conforming with company's policies.
• To continually research, develop and improve products and services offered aiming at being the most creative provider of services in the market.
• To coordinate with department staff to ensure that responses to queries are timely, professional and comprehensive.
• To create, maintain and administer client database on a program and liaise it with the Marketing Executive.
• To follow up on new customer leads and coordinate with the Aviation Department on the matter.
• To gain a full and thorough understanding of the different software solutions provided to Egyliere and to ensure that sales, pricing and contracting functions are all conducted with this understanding in mind.
• To negotiate with the different solution providers on Egyliere booking engine creation.
• To manage Egyliere Associates in order to deliver an impeccable service to Egyliere customers as per the company’s standards and requirements.
• To actively ask team members for ideas and suggestions and to create forums where people feel comfortable to speak up.
• To continuously seek ways in which the work can be improved and to react in a timely manner.
• To develop suggested remedies to attack areas of weakness.
• To arrange weekly update meetings with the team.
• To Encourage the team to build relationships with key partners and to improve departmental efficiency.
• To be able to set SMART goals and objectives effectively.
• To recognize successful completion of goals, objectives and projects and when appropriate celebrates successes.
• To handle stress and pressure in an effective manner, consistently maintaining high level of motivation and standard of work.
• To overcomes obstacles caused by conflicting priorities, lack of resources, difficult or demanding situations in the internal or external environment.
Qualifications:
*Experience in Travel from 3-5 years.
* Possesses Sales-Drive.
* Effective Communicator – Quick understanding of clients’ needs; capable of making recommendations accordingly.
* Ability to handle stress and work around-the-clock as required.
* Energetic, sensitive and enthusiastic.
* Ability to work independently, exercising discretion and judgment.
* Capability of maintaining a favorable company image when interfacing with outside sources.
* Multitasking: Skilled at working on simultaneous projects, without loss of details.
* Must be proficient in English. A second language is preferred but not required.

Title: Assistant Warehouse Keeper fresh
Description:
WE ARE HIRING THE FOLLOWING POSITION📣📢
Job Title: Assistant Warehouse Keeper
Location: Elkhanagry Group — giza
Employment Type: Full-time
Experience: 0–2 years
Reports to: Warehouse Supervisor / Warehouse Keeper
Summary
The Assistant Warehouse Keeper will support day-to-day warehouse operations, ensuring accurate inventory control, timely supply of components to production lines, and proper handling of finished goods. The role requires competency in MS Excel, attention to detail, and the ability to follow safety and quality procedures.
Key Responsibilities
Inventory & Stock Control
Receive, inspect, and record incoming materials and finished products.
Code, label and enter items into inventory records or warehouse management system.
Perform regular stock counts and assist with cycle counts and physical inventories.
Formulate and maintain clear, up-to-date stock lists and records in Excel.
Materials Handling & Production Support
Pick, stage and supply components to production lines according to production schedules and bills of materials.
Monitor component levels and raise supply requests or reorder notifications as needed.
Assist with dispensing, adding, and preparing items for production following established procedures.
Finished Goods Processing
Collect finished products from production lines, verify quantities and quality against production paperwork.
Record finished goods into inventory, assign appropriate codes/lot numbers, and update Excel records or WMS.
Prepare goods for dispatch or storage following packing and labeling standards.
Loading, Unloading & Logistics Support
Participate in loading and unloading of materials and finished goods; ensure safe and secure handling.
Help prepare shipment documentation and assist drivers or logistics partners during loading/unloading.
Maintain accurate records of inwards and outwards movements.
Documentation, Reporting & Compliance
Maintain clear, timely paperwork and Excel-based logs for receipts, issues, transfers and adjustments.
Support monthly/weekly inventory and production reports as requested by supervisors.
Adhere to company policies on safety, hygiene, quality and material handling procedures.
Housekeeping & Safety
Keep warehouse areas organized, clean and safe.
Use material handling equipment safely; report any equipment faults or safety hazards promptly.
Qualifications & Skills
Education: High school diploma or equivalent; vocational/technical certificates in logistics, warehousing, or related fields are a plus.
Experience: 0–2 years in warehouse, production support, or inventory roles preferred.
Technical Skills:
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (data entry, basic formulas, sorting/filtering, simple pivot tables preferred).
Familiarity with warehouse management systems (WMS) is an advantage.
Abilities:
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in recording and coding items.
Good organizational and time-management skills.
Ability to follow instructions and standard operating procedures.
Physically able to perform lifting, loading/unloading and prolonged standing/walking.
Personal attributes:
Team player, reliable, punctual, and proactive.
Good communication skills; basic reading/writing in [local language/English].
Working Conditions
Warehouse environment with exposure to noise, dust and variable temperatures depending on operations.
Manual material handling required; use of forklifts/pallet jacks where trained and authorized.
Shift patterns may include early starts and occasional overtime depending on production schedules.
Performance Indicators
Accuracy of inventory records.
Timeliness and accuracy of supplies to production lines.
Compliance with safety and handling procedures.
Responsiveness in receiving and coding finished goods.
How to Apply
Application Instructions
Please send your CV and a brief cover letter describing your relevant experience and achievements to Hr.elkhanagrygroup@elkhanagry.com with "
Assistant Warehouse Keeper " - [Your Name]" in the subject line. Please indicate your availability and current salary details, if applicable or on wathsapp:01000155993. Only candidates meeting the qualifications will be contacted.
ELKhanagry Group for Automotive Components Industries is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Senior Systems Administrator
Description:
Job Summary
The Senior Systems Administrator is responsible for designing, implementing, managing, and optimizing the organizations IT infrastructure. This role ensures high availability, security, and performance of servers, networks, and core systems while providing advanced technical support and mentoring junior team members.
What will you do?
Systems & Infrastructure Management
Manage, monitor, and maintain on-premises and cloud-based server environments (Windows/Linux).
Ensure system availability, performance, scalability, and reliability across all IT platforms.
Plan and execute system upgrades, patches, and migrations with minimal service disruption.
Implement and manage backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity solutions.
Security & Compliance
Enforce security standards, access controls, and system hardening practices.
Monitor systems for security threats, vulnerabilities, and compliance gaps.
Support audits and ensure adherence to IT policies, security standards, and regulatory requirements.
Incident, Problem & Change Management
Act as a senior escalation point for complex system incidents and outages.
Perform root cause analysis and implement preventive measures to avoid recurrence.
Review, approve, and execute system changes in line with change management processes.
Cloud & Virtualization
Manage virtualization platforms (VMware, Hyper-V) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Optimize system performance, capacity, and cost in virtual and cloud infrastructures.
Automation & Optimization
Develop scripts and automation tools to improve operational efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Continuously improve system performance through proactive monitoring and tuning.
Documentation & Knowledge Sharing
Maintain accurate documentation for system configurations, procedures, and architecture.
Provide technical guidance, mentoring, and knowledge transfer to junior system administrators.
Stakeholder & Vendor Management
Collaborate with internal teams (IT, Security, Operations, Business Units) to support business requirements.
Coordinate with vendors and service providers to ensure SLA compliance and service quality.
Qualifications & Skills
Education & Experience
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
5–8+ years of experience in systems administration or IT infrastructure roles.
Technical Skills
Strong experience with Windows Server and/or Linux environments.
Hands-on experience with virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Experience with Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Group Policy.
Familiarity with monitoring tools, backup solutions, and scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Python).
Understanding of ITIL processes, security frameworks, and best practices.
Preferred Certifications (Optional)
Microsoft (Azure Administrator / MCSA / MCSE)
VMware (VCP)
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator
ITIL Foundation
Soft Skills
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work under pressure and manage critical incidents.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Leadership and mentoring capabilities.

Title: Projects Manager
Description:
Company: Quarcom Engineering
Location: 6 October (Near Mall Of Egypt)
Position: Projects Manager (Pharmaceutical Industry)
About the Company
Quarcom Engineering is a specialized MEP contracting company providing advanced HVAC solutions for the pharmaceutical, clean room, and life sciences sectors. We deliver technically complex projects that meet the highest regulatory and quality standards.

Professional growth within a specialized engineering and MEP environment
Competitive compensation package

Please send your updated CV with the subject line
"Projects Manager"

Title: Arabic/English Bilingual Expert
Description:
You will review AI-generated Arabic and English responses and/or generate high-quality bilingual training content, evaluating reasoning quality and step-by-step problem-solving while providing expert feedback that helps models produce answers that are accurate, logical, and clearly explained. You will assess solutions for accuracy, clarity, and adherence to the prompt; identify errors in methodology or conceptual understanding; fact-check information; write high-quality explanations and model solutions that demonstrate correct methods; and rate and compare multiple AI responses based on correctness and reasoning quality. This is an hourly paid, fully remote contractor role with flexible work-from-anywhere hours. This job is with SME Careers (a subsidiary of SuperAnnotate), a fast-growing AI Data Services company providing training data for many of the world’s largest AI companies and foundation model labs—your work directly helps improve the world’s premier AI models.
Key Responsibilities
Develop AI Training Content: Create detailed prompts in various topics and responses to guide AI learning, ensuring the models reflect a comprehensive understanding of diverse subjects. (English proficiency required: Minimum C1)
Optimize AI Performance: Evaluate and rank AI responses to enhance the model's accuracy, fluency, and contextual relevance. (English proficiency required: Minimum C1)
Ensure Model Integrity: Test AI models for potential inaccuracies or biases, validating their reliability across use cases. (English proficiency required: Minimum C1)
Your Profile
Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Linguistics, Translation, Arabic Language, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.
Native or near-native Arabic proficiency with strong writing and editing skills across Modern Standard Arabic and at least one major dialect (Egyptian Arabic preferred).
Minimum C1 English proficiency (reading and writing) for bilingual evaluation and instruction adherence.
3+ years of professional experience in translation, localization, editorial QA, content quality, or linguistic review (or equivalent).
Excellent attention to detail and ability to apply detailed rubrics consistently in high-volume, hourly contractor work.
Strong fact-checking habits and comfort validating claims using reputable sources when required by task guidelines.
Ability to identify reasoning gaps, methodological errors, and unclear explanations—even when language is fluent.
Comfort working independently in a remote, asynchronous environment with reliable availability and communication.
Prior experience with AI data training, annotation, or evaluation workflows is strongly preferred.
Familiarity with Arabic localization conventions for MENA (terminology, formatting, cultural nuance) is preferred.

Title: Environment, Health and Safety Manager
Description:
Job Purpose
To ensure a safe, healthy, and environmentally compliant workplace by implementing EHS policies, ensuring compliance with legal and cosmetic industry standards, and supporting safe manufacturing, laboratory, and packaging operations.
Key Responsibilities
Environment (E)
Ensure compliance with environmental regulations related to cosmetics manufacturing (waste, effluents, emissions).
Manage hazardous and non-hazardous waste (chemicals, rejected cosmetics, packaging waste).
Coordinate with authorized vendors for waste disposal.
Monitor water usage, effluent treatment, and pollution control systems.
Support sustainability initiatives (waste reduction, eco-friendly practices).
Health & Safety (HS)
Develop, implement, and maintain EHS policies and SOPs.
Conduct risk assessments for:
Cosmetic formulation labs
Bulk manufacturing
Filling & packing lines
Warehousing & storage
Ensure safe handling, storage, and labeling of raw materials, fragrances, chemicals, and solvents.
Investigate accidents, incidents, and near-misses; implement corrective actions.
Conduct regular safety inspections and internal audits.
Manage PPE programs and ensure employee compliance.
Coordinate emergency preparedness (fire safety, chemical spills, evacuation drills).
Training & Awareness
Conduct EHS induction and periodic safety training for employees, contract staff, and visitors.
Train employees on:
Chemical safety (MSDS/SDS)
Laboratory safety
Fire safety and emergency response
Promote a strong safety culture across all departments.
Regulatory & Compliance
Ensure compliance with local EHS laws, labor safety regulations, and factory acts.
Maintain EHS documentation, permits, and records.
Support customer and third-party audits (ISO 14001, ISO 45001, GMP, customer audits).
Liaise with government authorities and regulatory bodies as required.
Collaboration
Work closely with Production, Quality, R&D, Engineering, and HR teams.
Support GMP and hygiene requirements specific to cosmetic private labeling.
Participate in management reviews and continuous improvement initiatives.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in
Environmental Science, Occupational Health & Safety, Engineering, Chemistry
, or related field.
EHS certifications (NEBOSH, IOSH, OSHA, or equivalent) preferred.
Knowledge of
cosmetic manufacturing processes and GMP
is an advantage.
Experience
10–15 years of EHS experience in
cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, FMCG, or chemical manufacturing
.
Experience in
private label manufacturing
is highly desirable.
Skills & Competencies
Strong knowledge of EHS regulations and best practices
Risk assessment and incident investigation
Good communication and training skills
Attention to detail and documentation
Ability to work cross-functionally
Industries: Soap and Cleaning Product Manufacturing and Personal Care Product Manufacturing

Title: Talent Acquisition Analyst (Contractor role)
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
Job Description
Role Summary
We are seeking a Talent Acquisition Contractor – Analyst to support Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) hiring and contractor program management across CISSEE markets. This role is pivotal in driving agility and speed in contractor hiring, ensuring compliance with Visa’s contingent workforce policies, and delivering an exceptional candidate experience.
You will partner closely with regional recruiters, hiring managers, and external agencies to manage end-to-end contractor hiring processes, while leveraging Visa’s tech-enabled TA stack for efficiency and data-driven decision-making.
Key Responsibilities
Contractor Hiring Execution
Manage full lifecycle recruitment for VCA contractor roles, including intake meetings, sourcing, screening, and onboarding.
Create and manage project related documents that are required as part of the onboarding process
Ensure compliance with Visa’s Contingent Worker Policy and local labor regulations.
Partner with approved staffing agencies and monitor adherence to Visa’s vendor guidelines.
Program Management & Reporting
Track contractor headcount, tenure, and budget alignment for CEMEA region.
Maintain accurate data in Workday and Fieldglass, ensuring timely updates and reporting to leadership.
Support governance processes, including attestation forms and tenure exception requests.
Perform monthly revenue recognitions and invoice receiving
Perform and execute administrative related tasks in a timely fashion
Stakeholder Engagement
Act as a trusted advisor to hiring managers, providing market insights and talent strategies for contractor roles.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Finance, Legal, HR Ops) to streamline processes and resolve escalations.
Candidate Experience & Branding
Deliver a seamless candidate experience, acting as a Visa culture ambassador.
Support recruitment marketing initiatives to attract top contractor talent for VCA projects.
Qualifications
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of relevant recruiting experience in a multinational, matrixed environment.
Proven track record in contractor hiring and program management, ideally within consulting or analytics domains.
Strong understanding of the payments landscape, financial institutions specifically and the related roles
Skills & Competencies
Strong consultative and stakeholder management skills.
Excellent organizational and time management abilities.
Familiarity with Workday, Fieldglass, and recruitment CRM tools.
Ability to work independently and deliver results under tight timelines.
Arabic language capability preferred
Additional Information
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Title: Mechanical Technical Office Engineer
Description:
 Participate in implementing technical office policies and procedures.
 Study the project contract documents (time schedule, project design drawings, BOQ, etc.).
 Update the shop drawing log before sending the shop drawing to consultant for approvals.
 Study and prepare requests for information (RFIs) for all missing, unclear, conflicting or other technical matters that may arise during construction.
 Review sub-contractors’ shop drawings as well as outsourced shop drawings and coordinate their approval process with the project consultant.
 Coordinate with Surveying Engineer to provide him all the information about land coordinates and any site measurement required.
 Participate in solving/reporting any unexpected technical difficulties, and other problems that may arise during construction to the Technical Office Manager for discussion and proper solve.
 Prepare as-built drawings at the end of the project and hand over to the project consultant.
 Ensure that employee is working according to the company HSE policies and regulations, and fully aware of his job risk assessment and environmental aspects.

Title: MRP Sction Head
Description:
Company Description
SN Automotive, founded in 2025 through a partnership between Al Safy Group and El Nasr Automotive Manufacturing Company, is a trailblazer in Egypt's automotive industry. Combining Al Safy Group’s market strength with El Nasr's manufacturing legacy, SN Automotive assembles and distributes locally produced and Completely Built-Up (CBU) vehicles. Focused on introducing global technologies and smart mobility solutions, SN Automotive represents premium brands from one of China’s most renowned automotive groups. Committed to quality and sustainability, the company is spearheading the development of Egypt’s first locally assembled electric vehicle (EV) and fostering premium aftersales services for customers.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site role based in Cairo, Egypt for an MRP Section Head. The MRP Section Head will oversee and manage the Material Requirement Planning (MRP) process, ensuring optimal coordination between supply chain, procurement, and production activities. Key responsibilities include analyzing material requirements, collaborating with procurement and operations teams, monitoring inventory levels, and developing accurate forecasting models. The role also involves leading and managing staff, resolving operational bottlenecks, and ensuring customer satisfaction by maintaining on-time delivery and high-quality service.
Qualifications
Strong knowledge and experience in Supply Chain Management and Procurement processes
Proficiency in Operations Management and organizational workflow optimization
Proven ability to lead teams effectively and promote a collaborative work environment
Excellent Customer Service skills and a record of ensuring customer satisfaction
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain, Logistics, Engineering, or a related field
Analytical and problem-solving skills with expertise in forecasting and resource planning
Proficiency in ERP systems and advanced understanding of MRP methodologies
Experience in the automotive or manufacturing industry is highly desirable

Title: Senior Medical Advisor - Cardiometabolic
Description:
Role Overview
We are seeking a highly experienced and scientifically driven
Senior Medical Advisor – Cardiometabolic
to lead medical strategy and high-impact scientific engagement across Egypt. This role requires deep expertise in cardiometabolic diseases and the ability to act as a trusted internal and external medical authority.
The Senior Medical Advisor will play a pivotal role in shaping local medical strategy, driving insight generation, supporting evidence-based decision-making, and ensuring the highest standards of medical governance, compliance, and scientific integrity. The role includes strategic leadership, senior KOL engagement, and mentoring within Medical Affairs.
Key Responsibilities
Act as a senior medical and scientific expert in cardiometabolic therapeutic areas, including diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular disease, dyslipidemia, and hypertension.
Lead the development and execution of local medical strategies and medical plans, aligned with global and regional objectives.
Serve as a trusted scientific partner to national and regional KOLs, academic institutions, and key healthcare stakeholders across Egypt.
Oversee and ensure high-quality, non-promotional scientific exchange, including communication of clinical trial data, real-world evidence, and disease-state education.
Generate, analyze, and synthesize medical insights from the field to inform medical strategy, evidence generation, and lifecycle management.
Provide senior medical leadership for advisory boards, scientific meetings, congresses, and symposia.
Support and provide medical oversight for clinical trials, investigator-initiated studies (IIS), real-world evidence, and post-marketing activities, as applicable.
Ensure accurate, timely, and compliant responses to unsolicited medical inquiries, in accordance with regulatory and company standards.
Act as a medical reference point and mentor for MSLs and junior medical colleagues, contributing to capability building and best practice sharing.
Collaborate closely with Regulatory Affairs, Market Access, Pharmacovigilance, and Commercial teams, while maintaining full medical independence.
Ensure full compliance with Egyptian Drug Authority (EDA) regulations, company SOPs, pharmacovigilance requirements, and ethical standards.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of local and international treatment guidelines, clinical literature, and the competitive landscape in cardiometabolic care.
Qualifications & Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in pharmacy or medicine (mandatory).
Advanced degrees (PharmD, MSc, PhD, or MD) are strongly preferred.
Formal training in Medical Affairs, Clinical Research, or Evidence-Based Medicine is an advantage.
Experience
Minimum 5 years of experience in Medical Affairs within the pharmaceutical industry. (Senior MSL, Medical Advisor, or equivalent), preferably in cardiometabolic or chronic disease areas.
Proven experience engaging senior KOLs, investigators, and academic leaders in Egypt.
Experience within multinational pharmaceutical companies is a strong advantage.
Demonstrated involvement in clinical trials, advisory boards, and major scientific congresses.
Skills & Competencies
Therapeutic Expertise: Deep scientific and clinical understanding of cardiometabolic diseases and evolving treatment paradigms.
Medical Strategy & Leadership: Ability to shape and execute impactful medical strategies at a country level.
Scientific Communication: Strong capability to communicate complex clinical data clearly, credibly, and compliantly.
Stakeholder Engagement: Trusted relationship builder with KOLs, investigators, and healthcare decision-makers.
Insight Generation & Analytics: Ability to translate field insights into actionable strategic recommendations.
Cross-Functional Influence: Effective collaboration across internal stakeholders while safeguarding medical integrity.
Compliance & Ethics: Strong knowledge of EDA regulations, pharmacovigilance, and ethical standards in Egypt.
People Development: Experience mentoring and developing MSLs and junior medical team members.
Language Skills: Fluency in English (written and spoken); Arabic fluency is required for local engagement.

Title: Marketing Executive
Description:
Informa Markets, a division within Informa, creates global platforms for industries. We organise over 500 large-scale branded and transaction-oriented events in 14 specialist markets. These are typically not-to-be-missed annual events where buyers and sellers build relationships, see and show products and do business.
We also provide year-round online platforms where companies showcase their businesses and products and buyers conduct research, generating valuable leads, and we provide data and digital content that supports the flow of knowledge and transactions in markets.
Job Description
This role is based in our Cairo Festival City Business Park, New Cairo, Cairo, Egypt office.
Reports to:
Marketing Manager
The Role:
The
Marketing Executive
position will support the marketing efforts for Cityscape events across multiple regions. This role is ideal for a proactive and detail-oriented marketing professional who is eager to grow their experience in event marketing within a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Marketing Executive will assist in campaign execution, stakeholder engagement, and onsite event support, while contributing to brand consistency and delivering measurable results. The role also involves collaborating with internal teams and external partners to enhance marketing strategies and achieve event objectives.
Job Summary/Responsibilities
Campaign Management and Execution:
Support the planning and execution of marketing campaigns across digital, social, email, and other channels to promote events, with a focus on delegate and visitor acquisition.
Assist in monitoring campaign performance metrics and preparing reports for the Marketing Manager, highlighting successes and areas for improvement.
Provide support in evaluating the performance of media, association, industry partners, and social media influencers, and share feedback and recommendations with the Marketing Manager.
Help maintain and update event websites, working with internal support teams to optimise conversions and user experience.
Assist in creating, copywriting, proofreading, and checking marketing materials under the guidance of the Marketing Manager, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines.
Conduct research to support database growth for events, including identifying competitor events and key industry leaders and influencers.
Assist in managing content marketing calendars and ensure social media channels are active and optimised for engagement and conversion.
Coordinate with event partners, sponsors, and speakers to share toolkits, gather marketing materials, and align promotional activities.
Support the establishment of media partnerships to maximise exposure at minimal cost, ensuring deliverables are actioned in a timely manner.
Assist with targeted data selections on the CRM, ensuring accurate segmentation for effective communication and campaign targeting.
Provide administrative support, including creating campaign trackers, maintaining tracking master files for events, and filing documents.
Onsite Event Support:
Provide marketing support during event execution, collaborating with the wider team to ensure smooth operations.
Assist in attendee marketing, supporting suppliers (e.g., PR agencies, social media agencies, photo/video teams) and coordinating their marketing requests and collateral.
Qualifications
Essential:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
2–3 years of experience in a marketing role, ideally within the events industry, with exposure to delivering campaigns.
Basic knowledge of event promotion and attendee acquisition.
Familiarity with email marketing platforms and design tools (e.g., Eloqua, Canva, or Adobe Creative Suite).
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with attention to detail and clarity.
Working knowledge of digital marketing tools, CRM systems, and social media management platforms.
Basic understanding of analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics) to measure campaign performance.
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to adapt to changing priorities.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Team player with good interpersonal skills, capable of collaborating effectively with colleagues, vendors, and customers.
Confident communication skills to engage with stakeholders at various levels.
Desirable:
Exposure to marketing automation technology and CMS platforms to support campaign processes.
Interest in the global real estate market and industry trends.
Familiarity with event branding and visual identity management.
Experience in supporting international audiences and campaigns.
Additional Information
We work hard to make sure Life at Informa is rewarding, supportive and enjoyable for everyone. Here’s some of what you can expect when you join us. But don’t just take our word for it – see what our colleagues have to say at LifeAt.Informa.com
Our benefits include:
Great community:
a welcoming culture with in-person and online social events, our fantastic Walk the World charity day and active diversity and inclusion networks
Broader impact:
take up to four days per year to volunteer, with charity match funding available too
Career opportunity:
the opportunity to develop your career with bespoke training and learning, mentoring platforms and on-demand access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning. When it’s time for the next step, we encourage and support internal job moves
Time out:
21 days annual leave, plus a birthday leave day and the chance to work from (almost!) anywhere for up to four weeks a year
A comprehensive company funded private medical insurance with international coverage
A ShareMatch scheme that allows you to become an Informa shareholder from the start of your employment, and benefit from free matching shares
Strong wellbeing support through EAP assistance, mental health first aiders, and access to health apps and more
Recognition for great work, with global awards and kudos programmes
As an international company, the chance to collaborate with teams around the world
We’re not solely focused on a checklist of skills. We champion energy and ambition and look for colleagues who will roll their sleeves up, join in and help make things happen. If it sounds like a match and you have most – although not all – of the skills and experience listed, we welcome your application.
If you would like to request reasonable adjustments or accommodations to assist your participation in the hiring process and, or in the advertised position, please inform the appropriate Talent Acquisition Partner for the role once they have been in touch. Your request will be reviewed and considered in confidence. At Informa, you'll find inclusive experiences and environments where all perspectives and backgrounds are welcomed. As part of this approach and our diversity and inclusion commitments, we are also formally an Equal Opportunities Employer. This means we base decisions on relevant qualifications and merit and do not discriminate on the basis of key characteristics and statuses, including all of those protected by law. Ask us or see our website for full information.
See how Informa handles your personal data when you apply for a job here.

Title: Construction Project Manager
Description:
Job Title for the new hire:
Sustainability PM
Job Description:
The Sustainability PM role is a strategic position focused on integrating environmental initiatives into building lifecycle. This position serves as the critical link between sustainability goals and execution, managing data collection and analysis for carbon reduction, water conservation, and waste management across large-scale construction portfolios including fulfillment centers, sort centers, and delivery stations. The role combines technical expertise in green building practices with strong project coordination skills, requiring the ability to conduct detailed design reviews, deploy carbon tracking mechanisms across EU projects, and develop comprehensive reporting dashboards. Key responsibilities include overseeing EC3 (Embodied Carbon in Construction Calculator) implementation, validating pilot programs for carbon optimization, and ensuring compliance with sustainability standards through systematic database management and stakeholder engagement. The position demands both independent execution capability and collaborative partnership with pre-construction and construction managers, sustainability program managers, and cross-functional teams to drive environmental commitments forward through actionable data insights and strategic program development.
Expected deliverables:
Weekly updates to central Buildings database; assurance of data accuracy.
Enhancements to central Buildings database, including visualizations and additional metric.
Outreach/ notification plan for key project milestones across the three miles.
Design review comments for sites as needed.
EC3 training materials, SOPs and follow up on sites reporting.
Meeting minutes/notes from EC3 training.
Monthly carbon reporting and documentation.
Documentation of optimization results, cost savings, and lessons learned.
White papers (as needed).
Carbon modeling support for in-flight construction projects.
Required qualifications/certifications:
➢Basic qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering.
7+ years of demonstrated experience in construction project management, real estate development, architecture/design with a Sustainability focus.
7+ years of program or project management experience.
Experience with sustainability-focused financial modeling and ROI analysis.
Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements.
Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership.
Demonstrated success in stakeholder management across organizational levels, with proven ability to deliver results independently in dynamic environments with shifting priorities.
Strong collaborative skills, demonstrating success in driving alignment on complex topics across large, cross-functional teams and initiatives.
➢Preferred qualifications:
Advanced degree (MBA, MS, etc.) LEED Accredited Professional, PE, CEM, LFA, or other building professional accreditation - Experience reading and interpreting building engineering drawings.
10+ years of demonstrated Green building experience and demonstrated industry-leading sustainability design and construction.
English language proficiency.
Software / programs / tools:
Data Management & Visualization (Smartsheet, Excel, QuickSight). Carbon & Sustainability Tracking, EC3 (Embodied Carbon in Construction Calculator). AI and automation tools (for data management and digitization)
Required Years of Experience: +7
Travel is required for this role:
Yes, up to 25%

Title: Project Coordinator
Description:
The Big Picture
DigiSay Group is a media tech company that started in 2010 focusing initially on creator services including content management and distribution. Today DigiSay acts as a media group with subsidiaries providing end to end services around the content life-cycle from inception to monetization. DigiSay aims to focus on the media sector from a technology, production, and venture-building perspective.
Main Responsibilities
As a Project Coordinator at DigiSay Group's Project Management Office, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and driving the success of various initiatives. This role demands a solid foundation in project management methodologies, marketing activities, and business development strategies, coupled with strong adaptability to dynamic project requirements.
Project Management
Implement and oversee project management best practices to ensure smooth execution and timely delivery.
Develop and maintain detailed project plans, including milestones, timelines, budgets, and deliverables.
Collaborate across teams to ensure project goals align with organizational objectives.
Marketing and Strategic Insights
Conduct in-depth market research to inform strategic decisions and project direction.
Design marketing materials and presentations, ensuring they effectively communicate key messages and resonate with diverse audiences.
Develop and refine strategic approaches that integrate data-driven insights and creative concepts.
Coordinate with creative teams to produce high-quality visual and written materials, such as brochures, pitch decks, and promotional content.
Business Development
Identify and map opportunities that align with the group's strategic vision and objectives.
Play an active role in shaping initiatives to support business growth and market expansion.
Contribute to crafting proposals, presentations, and other documentation for potential clients and stakeholders.
Client and Stakeholder Management
Coordinate with international clients across different time zones, ensuring seamless communication and service delivery.
Act as a primary liaison between clients and internal teams to address project needs and expectations.
Facilitate stakeholder meetings and provide regular project updates.
Flexibility and Adaptability
Adapt quickly to shifting project requirements and priorities based on client or organizational needs.
Demonstrate resilience and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Flexibility to work on different shifts, extra hours, and on official holidays and collaborate with clients and teams in varying time zones.
Continuous Learning and Innovation
Stay updated with industry trends, tools, and best practices to improve project outcomes.
Introduce innovative ideas to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness.
Share knowledge and recommendations to drive creativity within the team.
CEO-Directed Tasks
Handle and prioritize ad hoc tasks assigned directly by the CEO.
Ensure high-quality execution and follow-through of these tasks in alignment with the CEO’s vision.
Act as a key support function for high-priority and time-sensitive projects.
Support for Series and Movie Productions
Provide logistical and operational support for series and movie production projects.
Coordinate with production teams to ensure seamless communication and execution.
Assist in managing production schedules, budgets, and deliverables.
Requirements
Bachelor degree in Business Administration or related field.
2-4 years work experience of direct work in project management capacity.
Hands-on experience with project management tools (e.g. Clickup, Basecamp or Trello).
Experience in project management, from conception to delivery.
Adept at conducting research into project-related issues.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.
Strong written and verbal English communication skills.
Strong computer skills (i.e., Microsoft Excel).
Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management.
Strong client-facing and teamwork skills.
Nimble business mind with a focus on developing creative solutions.
Strong project reporting skills, with a focus on interdepartmental communication.

Continuously enhance your expertise in coffee, products, and services to tailor experiences for customers.

Title: Arabic Trust & Safety Data Trainer
Description:
In this hourly-paid, fully remote contractor role, you will review AI-generated responses and/or generate safety-focused evaluation content, assess reasoning quality and step-by-step problem-solving, and provide expert feedback so outputs are accurate, safe, and clearly explained. You will annotate and evaluate content in English and Arabic; you must be fluent/proficient (near-native or native) in Arabic and able to apply Minimum C1 English to interpret prompts and policies precisely. Your annotations on these explicit tasks will be used to prevent the Large Language Model from generating unintentional or adversarial, toxic, or unsafe outputs. The types of explicit content you may be exposed to may include, but are not limited to, those of a sexual, violent, or psychologically disturbing nature. This role is with SME Careers, a fast-growing AI Data Services company and a subsidiary of SuperAnnotate that provides AI training data for many of the world’s largest AI companies and foundation-model labs, helping improve the world’s premier AI models.
Key Responsibilities
Curate and label safety-focused training examples (including adversarial/red-team cases) in English and Arabic that probe model behavior across hate/harassment, sexual content, self-harm, violence, bias, illegal services, malicious activity, malicious code, and misinformation—capturing nuance and intent with Minimum C1 English and near-native French proficiency.
Review, score, and compare multiple model responses against safety policy and quality rubrics, documenting why an output is safe/unsafe and identifying failure modes such as evasion, normalization, escalation, or procedural enablement.
Continuously stress-test and audit model behavior for policy gaps and edge cases; flag ambiguous scenarios, propose clearer decision rules, and help maintain consistent annotation standards across reviewers.
Your Profile
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant field (e.g., Communications, Linguistics, Psychology, Law/Policy, Security Studies) or equivalent professional experience.
Near-native or native Arabic proficiency (reading/writing) for high-precision safety labeling and cultural-linguistic nuance.
Minimum C1 English proficiency (reading/writing) for policy interpretation, prompt understanding, and consistent documentation.
Experience in Trust & Safety, content moderation, policy enforcement, risk operations, investigations, or safety evaluation work.
LLM red teaming experience is a must (proven ability to probe safety boundaries and document adversarial patterns).
Strong knowledge of safety domains: Hate & Harassment, Sexual content, Suicide & Self-Harm, Violence, Bias, Illegal goods/services, malicious activities, malicious code, and deliberate misinformation.
Emotional resilience: an understanding that this role requires annotating texts that contain unsafe, explicit, and/or toxic content, including content of a sexual, violent, or psychologically disturbing nature.
Excellent judgment under ambiguity, with the ability to apply written policies consistently and explain decisions succinctly.
Comfort working as an hourly contractor: dependable throughput, clear documentation, and responsiveness across time zones.
Previous experience with AI data training / annotation / evaluation is preferred.
Strong hands-on experience using tools like Perplexity, Gemini, ChatGPT and others.

Title: Guest Experience Agent
Location: Sharm El Sheikh, South Sinai, Egypt
Description:
About Four Seasons
Four Seasons is powered by our people. We are a collective of individuals who crave to become better, to push ourselves to new heights and to treat each other as we wish to be treated in return. Our team members around the world create amazing experiences for our guests, residents, and partners through a commitment to luxury with genuine heart. We know that the best way to enable our people to deliver these exceptional guest experiences is through a world-class employee experience and company culture.
At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.
About the location:
A true home away from home. Four Seasons Resort at Sharm El Sheikh dedicates to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality. From elegant surroundings of the finest quality, to caring, highly personalized 24-hour service, Four Seasons embodies a true home away from home for those who know and appreciate the best. The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture personifies by its employees - people who share a single focus and encourage to offer phenomenal service.
About The Role
The Guest Experience Agent at Four Seasons Resort Sharm El Sheikh plays a vital role in supporting the Guest Experience Team to deliver exceptional, personalized, and memorable experiences for hotel guests. The primary objective of this position is to enhance guest satisfaction and foster long-term loyalty by facilitating seamless interactions, addressing concerns promptly, and ensuring the high quality of amenities, services, and facilities. The Guest Experience Agent collaborates closely with the Front Office Team and Hotel Assistant Managers to uphold and exceed the hotel's service standards, contributing to an overall elevated guest experience.
What You Will Do
Handles all guest interactions with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism.
Accommodating special requests whenever possible.
Daily guest interactions and resolving glitches.
Assists customers in all inquiries concerning hotel services, hours of operations, key hotel personnel, in-house events, directions, etc.
Supporting the other departments during busy periods.
What You Bring
Required Skills & Knowledge:
A working knowledge of division operations, typically gained through on-the-job experience.
Ability to operate computer equipment and other department systems.
Proficiency in reading, writing, and speaking English.
Experience & Expertise
More than one year of experience in related roles, with sufficient exposure to Rooms Division departments.
Advanced computer skills, including experience with Opera systems, and strong guest service capabilities.
Guest Interaction & Service
Strong interpersonal skills, with a warm and welcoming approach to hotel guests.
Provides exceptional, consistent service, adhering to the Golden Rule and maintaining guest satisfaction.
Complaint Handling & Problem Solving
Efficient in managing complaints and resolving issues, with creative and practical solutions to enhance service quality.
Always maintains a positive attitude, even during challenging or busy periods.
Multi-tasking & Operational Involvement
Demonstrates the ability to multi-task and work effectively with diverse individuals and groups to ensure top-quality service.
Actively participates in operations and role models excellent service to both guests and employees.
What We Offer
Competitive Salary, wages, and a comprehensive benefits package
Excellent Training and Development opportunities
Complimentary Accommodation at other Four Seasons Hotels and Resort
Complimentary Dry Cleaning for Employee Uniforms
Complimentary Employee Meals
Schedule & Hours
Full-time position
Flexible availability required including early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed
Shifts typically range between 8 hours depending on operational needs
As a Guest Experience Agent, you will play a key role in ensuring every guest enjoys a personalized and memorable stay and deliver service excellence that reflects the brand’s commitment to luxury and hospitality.

Title: Incident Response & Forensics Manager (IT & OT)
Description:
The Incident Response & Forensics Manager (IT & OT) is responsible for managing and leading the organization's incident response and forensic investigation efforts across both Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT) environments. This role ensures that security incidents are promptly detected, contained, investigated, and remediated, while also overseeing the collection and analysis of forensic evidence. The manager coordinates across multiple teams to enhance the organization’s ability to respond to cyber incidents, minimize damage, and prevent future security breaches within both IT and OT domains.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Incident Response Management (IT & OT):
Lead and manage the organization's incident response efforts across both IT and OT systems, ensuring rapid detection, containment, and resolution of security incidents.
Develop and maintain incident response playbooks, ensuring that they address specific threats to both IT and OT environments.
Coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure effective communication and collaboration during incident response efforts.
Oversee the triage, prioritization, and escalation of security incidents, ensuring that critical threats are addressed in a timely manner.
Provide incident response support to both IT and OT infrastructure teams, advising on containment actions and recovery steps.
Offer remediation guidance including configuration changes and preventive measures to minimize future threats in both IT and OT systems.
Triage alerts from detection platforms, identifying and removing false positives across IT and OT environments.
Escalate genuine threats and security incidents to the appropriate teams for further investigation and remediation, ensuring timely and accurate response to both IT-based and OT-based threats.
Forensic Investigation (IT & OT):
Lead digital forensic investigations within both IT and OT systems to determine the root cause of security incidents, ensuring the proper collection, preservation, and analysis of digital evidence.
Utilize forensic tools and techniques to investigate compromised systems, networks, and devices across IT and OT infrastructures.
Ensure that forensic processes adhere to legal and regulatory requirements, and that evidence is documented in a formal and defensible manner for potential legal proceedings.
Threat Detection & Analysis (IT & OT):
Conduct continuous monitoring of security events across both IT and OT environments using SIEM, XDR, and other Threat Detection, Investigation, and Response (TDIR) platforms.
Analyze telemetry from multiple sources (network traffic, endpoints, OT systems, etc.) to detect and investigate potential cyber threats, ensuring comprehensive coverage across both digital and physical systems.
Monitor and analyze security events from various sources—including SIEM, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), firewalls, endpoint detection systems, and OT-specific monitoring tools—to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
Lead efforts to correlate security information from both IT and OT environments to identify patterns of anomalous behavior and mitigate potential threats.
Incident Reporting & Documentation:
Document formal technical incident reports for consumption by IT and OT infrastructure teams and senior leadership, providing detailed information on root causes, affected systems, and next steps.
Ensure clear and concise communication of incident details to both IT and OT stakeholders, enabling effective decision-making during and after incidents.
Ensure accurate and detailed documentation of all security incidents, including timelines, actions taken, and outcomes, for post-incident reviews and compliance reporting.
Prepare formal incident reports and technical summaries for senior management, internal stakeholders, and regulatory authorities as required.
Conduct post-incident reviews and lessons learned sessions to identify opportunities for improvement in incident response procedures for both IT and OT environments.
Collaboration & Coordination:
Work closely with threat hunting teams to optimize TDIR capabilities by incorporating findings from threat hunting activities in both IT and OT environments.
Continuously improve detection and response strategies based on real-world threat activity affecting both IT networks and OT systems.
Collaborate with IT engineering, OT operations, cybersecurity teams, and third-party vendors to coordinate response efforts and ensure that both IT and OT systems are fully protected during and after an incident.
Work closely with threat intelligence teams to stay updated on emerging threats to both IT and OT systems and ensure that the organization’s incident response strategy remains current and effective.
Provide incident response support to both IT and OT infrastructure teams, advising on containment actions and recovery steps.
Offer remediation guidance including configuration changes and preventive measures to minimize future threats in both IT and OT systems.
Incident Response Training & Drills:
Develop and conduct regular incident response simulations and training exercises across both IT and OT teams to ensure readiness for real-world cyber incidents.
Ensure that all relevant personnel are trained in their roles during an incident and are familiar with the incident response plan for both IT and OT systems.
Detection Platform Enhancement (IT & OT):
Work with threat detection content development teams to fine-tune detection platforms and create new detection rules tailored to the unique needs of both IT and OT environments.
Continuously enhance detection capabilities to improve alert accuracy and reduce false positives in both IT systems (e.g., endpoints, networks) and OT systems (e.g., SCADA, ICS).
Root Cause Analysis & Prevention (IT & OT):
Conduct in-depth root cause analysis of security incidents across IT and OT systems, identifying vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, or other weaknesses.
Provide recommendations for mitigating future risks, including configuration changes and security controls for both IT infrastructure and OT control systems.
Policy Development & Incident Response Governance
:
Assist in the development and refinement of incident response policies, forensic procedures, and security standards for both IT and OT environments.
Ensure that incident response efforts comply with relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices for both IT and OT sectors.
compliance & Performance Reporting (IT & OT):
Support the development and execution of compliance reporting for both IT and OT teams, ensuring that security incidents and responses are documented in line with organizational and regulatory requirements.
Provide SOC performance reporting to ensure key metrics and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met for both IT and OT operations.
Vulnerability & Exposure Analysis (IT & OT):
Conduct analysis and testing to identify vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and other exposures across both IT and OT environments.
Validate user policies, configurations, and access controls to ensure they align with the security posture of both IT and OT systems, maintaining a holistic security approach.
Efficiency & SLA Adherence (IT & OT):
Work efficiently to meet SOC metrics and SLAs, ensuring timely and effective response to incidents affecting both IT infrastructure and OT control systems.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred).
5+ years of experience in incident response, digital forensics, or cybersecurity operations, with at least 2 years focusing on OT environments.
Proficiency in incident response tools, forensic tools, and SIEM platforms (e.g., Splunk, ELK, QRadar).
Experience with both IT and OT-specific security platforms (e.g., SCADA, ICS, PLC systems).
Knowledge of forensic analysis techniques across networks, endpoints, and OT systems.
Familiarity with threat intelligence, malware analysis, and vulnerability management for both IT and OT infrastructures.

Title: Plant Manager - Nubariya
Description:
Location : New Nubariya
Key Responsibilities of the Role
The Plant Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operational management of the Nubariya plant to ensure safe, compliant, and efficient production and dispatch of fertilizer products in line with approved production plans, quality requirements, and budgeted costs.
The role ensures effective coordination of people, equipment, materials, utilities, contractors,and site services so that production targets, quality standards, delivery commitments, and cost objectives are consistently achieved.
The Plant Manager leads daily plant execution through Production, Maintenance, Warehouse,and site support functions, resolves operational issues, and escalates risks or constraints to the Site Director as required.
HESQ
Adhere to applicable Egyptian legislation, Our Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HESQ) policies, and the Golden Rules.
Ensure that all plant operations comply with HSE, environmental, quality, and lab release requirements.
Fully respect and enforce stop-work or stop-production decisions issued by HESQ, Quality, or Lab functions.
Ensure incidents, near misses, and unsafe conditions are reported and investigated in line with company requirements.
Support implementation of corrective and preventive actions following safety or quality incidents.
Serve as a role model for safety compliance, operational discipline, and safe leadership behavior.
People Management
Lead and managedepartmentsthrough their respective managers.
Ensure clear accountability, performance expectations, and disciplined execution across all shifts.
Enforce attendance, discipline, and standard work fairly and consistently.
Identify capability gaps and coordinate training and staffing needs with HR.
Operations
Own the day-to-day operational performance of the plant against approved production plans (safety, volume, quality,cost, and delivery).
Chair the daily operations meeting to review safety alerts, production performance, downtime, risks, and agreed actions.
Ensure effective shift handovers and enforcement of standard operating proceduresthrough the department managersto maintain stable and predictable plant operation.
Approve and align weekly and daily production plans prepared by the Production Manager, ensuring feasibility and resource availability.
Remove operational constraints impacting execution by coordinating actions across Production, Maintenance,Warehouse, and support functions.
Lead production through the Production Manager by setting priorities and holding accountability, without direct shift supervision.
Monitor operating costs, challenge inefficiencies, and work with Finance and Purchasing on cost variances, service contracts, and energy consumption without compromising safety or quality.
External Relations & Governance
Represent the plant in interactions with local authorities, regulators, and external auditors.Coordinate site inspections, audits, and official visits, and ensure timely closure of findings.
Maintain operational inputs to site registrations, permits, and renewals with support from HESQ, HR, and Finance.Act as the primary on-site point of contact for operational issues with external parties, including utilities and
community stakeholders where required.
Escalate major incidents, regulatory risks, repeated breakdowns, or production threats to the Site Director with clear facts and recovery plans.
Education, Experience, and Personal Attributes
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or related discipline.
Experience
Ideally with supervisory experience gained within a similar production environment.
Minimum 10 years’ experience in manufacturing operations within a process industry (chemical, fertilizer,petrochemical, or similar).
At least 5 years in a plant, production, or operations leadership role with accountability for safety, output, cost, and people.
Strong experience working in multi-shift environments.
Proven exposure to Egyptian regulatory compliance, inspections, and audits.
Experience coordinating maintenance activities, contractors, and shutdowns.
High level of computer literacy (ERP systems, MS Office, reporting tools).
Personal Attributes
High level of safety awareness and a good understanding of the Health and Safety and other attendant regulations.
Highly organized, with the ability to effectively prioritise and plan the workload of self and others.
Good communication skills–both written and verbal.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills

Title: Tourism Services & Packages Officer
Description:
Job Description:
The Tourism Services & Packages Officer is responsible for developing, managing, and promoting travel packages and tourism services. This includes coordinating with suppliers, ensuring the best value offerings for clients, handling customer inquiries, and supporting the sales team with customized packages. The officer ensures all services are delivered with high quality and aligned with client expectations and company standards.
Department
: Tourism & Travel Operations
Location: Dokki Giza
Key Responsibilities:
- Design and prepare travel packages (domestic and international) including accommodation, transportation, tours, and activities.
- Coordinate with hotels, airlines, transport providers, tour guides, and other suppliers to secure competitive rates and quality services.
- Handle customer inquiries, provide accurate information, and assist in selecting suitable travel services.
- Customize itineraries according to client preferences, budgets, and special requests.
- Ensure timely and accurate booking of all travel components.
- Maintain up-to-date knowledge of travel trends, visa requirements, and destination-specific information.
- Support marketing efforts by preparing content and package details for promotional materials.
- Collaborate with the sales team to understand client needs and provide package options accordingly.
- Monitor and follow up on service quality and customer satisfaction.
- Maintain a database of suppliers, packages, and client history for efficient operations.
- Manage booking confirmations, payments, invoicing, and travel documentation.
- Resolve customer complaints or issues efficiently and professionally.
- Prepare regular reports on bookings, package performance, and client feedback.
Experience Required:
Minimum 6 years of progressive experience in the travel and tourism industry, with a strong focus on domestic and international tourism services, package creation, and customer handling.
Prior experience in a tourism company or travel agency is essential.
Familiarity with GDS systems (e.g., Amadeus, Galileo) is a plus.
Proven record of building partnerships with tourism service providers.

Provides solution-related information to Project Managers, Installation Supervisors and Maintenance Supervisors
CSE Engineer, Solution role in the KONE SEB process
Shares knowledge with maintenance as needed
General responsibilities
Participates in product and new services release information-sharing sessions
Provides technical trainings to Sales, Installation and Maintenance as per Front Line needs
Offers input to the product offering management about customisation, standardisation and interface requirements for the portfolio
Contribution to the Customer Solutions Engineering virtual and local network

Is the primary front line technical contact person for the Supply Line Tendering Engineers

Title: Global Support Coordinator (PIM/DAM)
Description:
About this Position
The PIM/DAM Coordinator will play a crucial role in supporting our e-Commerce and B2B business initiatives, ensuring that product information is accurately reflected across all digital platforms. This position involves collecting and maintaining product information and digital assets, coordinating approval processes, and ensuring timely and accurate updates in our PIM (Product Information Management) and DAM (Digital Asset Management) systems
What You´ll Do
Information Collection & Coordination: Assist brand/project managers and business stakeholders in product content collection, approval / sign off and release into PIM, along with reviewing the data as the country specifics
Content Upload: uploading product content into the PIM system + ready respective content in upstream systems via DAM (Pack shot check, marketing materials check)
Digital Asset Management: Support the collection and validation of the product digital assets in the DAM tool.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with all stakeholders involved in the PIM and DAM systems processes, Track timelines, remind stakeholders to deliver their input, validate inputs, and escalate issues to project owners as needed
What makes you a good fit
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or any related field.
0-2 years of experience
Language Skills: Fluency in English (verbal and written) is a must.
Experience: Experience in Administrative, Project Coordination & Strong project management skills.
Technical Skills: Advanced knowledge of Excel is an advantage, Previous experience with tools like DevOps and digital visual tools like (Microsoft whiteboard, Miro, Visio) is a plus
Skills: Detail Orientation, Strong attention to detail, Pro-activity, Organizational, Teamwork and Strong verbal and written communication
Some perks of joining Henkel
Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per year
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Global wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programs
Gender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeks
Employee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching shares
Comprehensive Health Insurance for employee + dependents
Employee Assistance Programme provides a wide range of mental health and wellbeing benefits
At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We look for a diverse team of individuals who possess different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and mindsets.

Title: EHS Supervisor
Description:
At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.
Could you be the full-time onsite EHS Supervisor in Cairo, EG we’re looking for?
Key accountabilities:
Support Project EHS manager for EHS topics
Cooperate with the internal resources to achieve EHS objectives.
Support the Project EHS Manager to prepare, implement and maintain emergency plans.
Assist Project EHS Manager to coordinate and control activities with respect of EHS, especially where interfaces are involved with other contractors or operation areas.
Recognize the best practices and the good performance. React to violations to regulations and Alstom Standards.
Raise awareness of Project personnel on all aspects of EHS applicable to project activities & provide support.
Develop Project EHS Management System
Support the Project EHS Manager to develop, deploy and maintain the local procedures and tools and make sure they are aligned with Alstom Standards and international standards (ISO14001 and ISO 45001).
Support the Project EHS Manager to ensure that Alstom EHS standards and tools (Global EHS procedures/standerds, Global environmental procedures/standerds, Transport Key processes) are deployed at Project level.
Support the Project personnel to perform EHS Risk Assessment and to define appropriate measures to control risks.
EHS Compliance
Assist the Project EHS Manager to ensure compliance of the project activities according to the EHS Plan, guidelines, legal requirements, and work instructions.
Develop EHS culture in the project
Inform, instruct and train employees to carry out the work in safe & environment-friendly mode according to the method of statement.
Participate in the implementation of the project EHS training programs by providing EHS inductions and ensuring Tool Box meetings are organized.
Report, Measure & Review
Support the EHS Project Manager to capture, report, record, investigate and analyze accidents/incidents/observations to implement corrective and preventive actions.
Support the preparation of monthly EHS reports. Can be in charge of feeding EHS Teranga reporting system in line with Group reporting requirements and under control by Project EHS manager.
Carry out inspections of work areas and carry out EHS audits and report any discrepancy.
Things you’ll enjoy
Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
Work with dedicated professionals to improve EHS practices and achieve safety excellence,
Utilise our proactive and dynamic working environment,
Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues,
Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!
Important to note
As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.
Industries: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
