Title: Head of Sustainability (Cocoa) - Cote d'Ivoire
Description:
About Us
As a leading provider of high-quality food and beverage ingredients, we work with farming communities across the globe to grow, source and produce ingredients that are good for consumers, farmers, and the world around us. We supply household food brands and manufacturers worldwide with cocoa, coffee, dairy, nuts and spices ingredients which are often grown on our own farms and estates and sourced from hundreds of thousands of farmers across :50 countries. Along with our diverse manufacturing and innovation capabilities, this means we can provide ingredients for a range of products, from a plant-based latte mix to an almond based snack bar or a dairy-free ice cream.  Making a positive impact on people and planet is a core component of our Purpose, to be the change for good food and a healthy future. With a deep-rooted presence in the countries where our ingredients are grown, we are closer to farmers, enabling better quality, and more reliable, traceable, and transparent supply. And whoever we’re with, whatever we’re doing, we always make it real.
Product Information
Cocoa
We are a leading supplier of cocoa beans and cocoa ingredients, including cocoa powder, cocoa butter, and cocoa liquor, ranking among the top three processors worldwide. We are a cocoa supplier that provides great natural cocoa ingredients to customers all over the world, working with partners across the supply chain to create indulgent treats for consumers while helping to provide a positive future for cocoa. We work closely with our customers to inspire new concepts and solve for challenges they face in developing new cocoa products for their consumers, while delivering value to their business. Building on two decades of supporting farmers and cocoa-growing communities, around the world, we launched Cocoa Compass in October 2019, with the report published in 2024 winning Sustainability Report of the Year at the UK Green Business Awards! It sets challenging goals to tackle the key issues facing the cocoa supply chain by 2030, with interim milestones for action. We are proud to have already achieved, in 2020, 100% traceability and deforestation monitoring in our direct cocoa supply chain. We source from nine regions across Africa, South America and Asia and operate processing, milling, and refining facilities close to major consumption markets in Europe, the Americas, and Asia. Our cocoa brand portfolio includes deZaan, with over 100 years of excellence, Unicao, Joanes, Macao, Husyman, as well as Britannia specialty fats
Job Responsibilities
Oversee Program implementation and deployment
Ensure thorough and efficient planning, budgeting, execution and reporting of all customer programs and other sustainability initiatives (costs, quality, integrity, timing…)
Managing the CDI Cocoa Sustainability Operations Lead and collaborating with the rest of the CDI Sustainability team to ensure efficient and effective program execution through appropriate activities planning and follow up.
Managing all program budgets set up and execution, including negotiations and management of actuals against budget.
Collaborate with procurement team for selection and evaluation of farmer groups and procurement strategy in the supply chains where the programs are deployed.
Leading collaboration with procurement team to ensure cocoa volume delivery from the supply chains where programs are deployed.
Ensure adequate reporting of activities to Customers and External stakeholders. As well as constant communication and reassurance on questions of implementation status of the programs
Maintain customer relationships to ensure that the development and implementation of the program is aligned with expectations and fully communicated.
Managing all local external stakeholders involved in delivering sustainability initiatives (CCC, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Employment, Ministry of Health, UNICEF, USAID, NGO delivery partners…)
Lead strategy set up and deployment of activities to comply with EUDR and other regulations applying to cocoa. Traceability, human rights… in both direct and indirect supply chain,
Establish, develop, and maintain network of stakeholders to ensure that ofi remains at the forefront of rules and regulations related to sustainability, ensuring that ofi perspective and interests are well communicated (CCC, WCF, ICI…).
Manage relationship with local and international customer representatives. Organize and lead regular customer updates and visits, operational and strategic reviews.
Develop innovative program proposals with full financial evaluation, to fulfil ofi objectives and partner demands.
Develop and lead an efficient organization (talent management). Ensure the team is correctly engaged and evaluated to deliver all objectives. Managing (recruiting, appraising, structuring…) a team of more than 60 people (including 1 manager and several officers) to deliver each of the very complex programs listed above including coaching them to deliver customer service through on time execution and reporting. Ensuring objectives are set, team is evaluated and engaged, and talents are developed and managed.
Keep updated processes and procedures for implementation of sustainability programs and sustainable supply chains; and always ensure their application.
Ensure continuous evaluation and review of sustainability activities, and implementation processes and procedures to keep them as relevant and efficient as possible.
Support agroforestry and agronomy teams in delivering their objectives and initiatives.
Ensure that all third party involved in ofi supply chain are verified and compliant.
Job Requirements
Education / Degree: BAC + 4/5
Specialization: Agro-economist or Rural Development economist, Business Administration or Project management
Professional Experience: 10 to 15 years minimum in the sustainability area, large project management and team management
Handle multiple activities concurrently.
Strong quantitative / analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrate passion for sustainability.
Strong team leadership with multiple layers of reporting line
Strong team player able to work effectively and flexibly in a team environment.
Positive, highly motivated individual with strong leadership and management qualities
Flexibility - ability to adjust to changes in process.
Computer literate with independent use of Microsoft Office
Attention to detail and organization.
Ability to work independently with high-pressure situations and a constantly changing work environment.
Overall, the ability to work under pressure, managing conflicting requirements whilst meeting.
Excellent English oral and written communication skills are essential.
ofi
is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to racial or ethnic origin, color, age, religion or belief, sex, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
Applicants are requested to complete all required steps in the application process including providing a resume/CV in order to be considered for open roles.

Title: Legal Counsel
Description:
Our mission
We're making Africa the first cashless continent.
In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason—the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.
We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across 9 countries and are growing fast.
Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in...
How you'll help us achieve it
As a Legal Counsel at Wave, you will play a key role in supporting our Côte d'Ivoire Legal Team and contributing to the company's growth and compliance objectives.
You will work closely with both operational and functional teams to help them achieve their goals while proactively identifying, assessing, and managing legal risks to ensure full compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
In this role, you will be responsible for providing straightforward, practical, and business-oriented legal advice, as well as implementing legal strategies that protect the company's interests and contribute to its overall success.
Contracting
Draft, review, and negotiate contracts across all business areas to align with company objectives and legal requirements.
Support contract work for core products/services, balancing legal protection with commercial value.
Lead high-value, complex contract negotiations, providing strategic legal guidance.
Improve and manage contracting processes, including policies, management systems, e-signature tools, and document archiving.
Legal Operations
Implement group legal policies and propose updates in response to legal developments, operational feedback, and industry best practices.
Litigation
Develop and execute procedures for managing claims and disputes, including pre-litigation strategies, mediation, arbitration, and litigation follow-up.
People Support
Provide legal guidance on employment matters, including contracts, disciplinary actions, and terminations.
Company Secretarial
Oversee company secretarial responsibilities in collaboration with the Head of Regulatory Affairs/Company Secretary.
Risk Management
Work with Risk and Controls teams to identify legal risks and implement mitigations and internal controls.
Data Privacy & Consumer Protection
Support rollout and enforcement of the company’s data privacy compliance framework.
Regulatory Support
Provide legal advice on licensing and regulatory requirements, collaborating with legal and compliance colleagues.
External Counsel Management
Maintain relationships with external law firms and manage their service delivery.
Special Projects
Contribute to cross-functional legal initiatives and support ad hoc legal priorities.
Key details
Location: You'll work from our office in Côte d'Ivoire.
This is a permanent position.
Our salaries are competitive and calculated using a transparent formula.
We offer generous health insurance for yourself and your dependents.
We support working parents - we offer generous parental leave policies (26 weeks for mothers and 4 weeks for fathers) and subsidized child care when you return to work.
We help you live your fullest life now - we subsidize gym memberships and fitness classes.
Airtime reimbursement.
Requirements
Master's degree in Law or equivalent.
3–5 years of professional legal experience, ideally within a dynamic corporate or regulatory environment.
Fluency in both written and spoken French and English.
Proven experience in corporate governance, including planning and preparing for board and shareholder meetings.
Strong knowledge of general legal and regulatory requirements applicable to corporate and commercial activities.
You might be a good fit if you
Efficiently and quickly apply instructions from your lead, and proactively identify and report problems or blockers.
Excel in both teamwork and independent work.
Are proficient in drafting and reviewing contracts in English and French.
Demonstrate tenacity and a commitment to completing tasks.
Possess a strong analytical approach to problem-solving.
Are highly organized and detail-oriented, with a clear and accurate legal approach.
Have excellent writing, listening, and communication skills, consistently striving for excellence in all endeavors.
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, Côte d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, Uganda, Niger, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
We are on Y Combinator's top companies by revenue.
How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and a cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.
We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.
Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Stagiaire Juridique et Fiscal F/H
Description:
Rejoindre Deloitte, c'est dire oui à une expérience qui a du sens, celle où les rencontres et les missions vous poussent à grandir chaque jour. C’est évoluer dans un environnement de travail fondé sur la confiance, la transmission et l’intelligence collective pour construire l’avenir de nos clients. Un avenir que nous voulons plus responsable, plus durable et respectueux de l’environnement en prenant des initiatives concrètes à notre échelle.
Et vous, prêts à dire
#ISayYes
à votre futur chez Deloitte ?
Deloitte est présent sur l’ensemble du continent africain notamment en Afrique francophone, anglophone et lusophone et met son expertise au service de ses clients en Afrique.
En Afrique francophone Deloitte est présent en Afrique du Nord, en Afrique de l’Ouest et en Afrique centrale et dispose de 12 bureaux avec une capacité d'intervention sur 19 pays Deloitte mobilise plus de 1 500 collaborateurs dans les activités de Consulting, d’Audit Assurance, de conseil Juridique et Fiscal, de Risk Advisory, de Financial Advisory et de Business Outsourcing.
En tant que firme multidisciplinaire, Deloitte offre à ses clients un accompagnement de proximité et sur mesure grâce à la maîtrise des enjeux locaux afin de répondre aux attentes et aux besoins des acteurs publics et privés (Assurances, Technologies Médias Télécoms, Santé, Consumer Business, Energie).
Quel sera votre rôle dans la #TeamDeloitte ?
Au sein de Deloitte Côte d’Ivoire, vous intégrez nos équipes Tax & Legal dont le rôle est d'assister les clients dans tout ce qui touche au droit des affaires et à la fiscalité nationale et internationale.
Sous la direction de l’Associée Tax & Legal et au sein d’une équipe juridique et fiscale, vos missions consisteront à :
Développer au quotidien vos connaissances techniques, pratiques et méthodologiques en droit et fiscalité
Rédiger des notes, conclusions et livrables clairs et argumentés, en vous appuyant sur les textes juridiques, règlements et la doctrine
Effectuer des recherches documentaires précises et approfondies
Prioriser les tâches selon leur urgence et importance
Respecter les délais et faire preuve de rigueur dans l’exécution des missions confiées
Suivre les instructions et directives données dans le cadre de missions récurrentes
Assurer un reporting régulier à votre encadrant (N+1)
Solliciter l’accompagnement de votre N+1 en cas de difficulté ou de doute
Produire des livrables de qualité sur le fond comme sur la forme
Adopter un comportement professionnel et responsable au sein de l’équipe
Vous participerez aux programmes de formations proposés pour renforcer progressivement ces compétences et en acquérir de nouvelles. Tout au long de votre expérience, vous grandissez grâce à un management de proximité, de responsabilisation et d’accompagnement personnalisé.
Et si c’était vous ?
Titulaire d’un Master 2 en droit des affaires et/ou fiscalité des entreprises, ayant une première expérience dans un cabinet de Conseil juridique et fiscal;
Bonne connaissance de l’Anglais à l’oral et à l’Ecrit;
Sens de l'équipe et qualités d'analyse et de synthèse;
Ponctualité et assiduité;
Maitrise du Pack Office.
Vous serez pleinement intégré(e) à l’équipe.
Vous aurez accès à toutes les ressources du cabinet et pourrez travailler sous la supervision d’un Consultant senior et de spécialistes chevronnés chargés de vous former avec bienveillance.

Who We Are

mission and vision
, and the values of equality and excellence that guide our organization. We seek dedicated individuals who align with our mission and are passionate about making it a reality by collaborating with others, embracing learning and innovation, and delivering results.
What We Are Looking For

Job Title:
DIRECTOR FINANCES AND OPERATIONS/Directeur des Finances et des Opérations
Job Location(s):
Cote D'Ivoire - Abidjan
Résumé du poste
CARE Côte d'Ivoire/Guinée recherche un Directeur/une Directrice des Finances et des Opérations et qui sera basé(e) à Abidjan.
Le Directeur/La Directrice des Finances et des Opérations, est en charge d'assumer les fonctions finances et opérations de CARE Côte d'Ivoire/Guinée, en veillant à leur alignement avec la stratégie et la vision de CARE. Ce rôle implique le développement d'une équipe réactive et efficace, ainsi que la supervision des domaines suivants : Finance, Administration, NTIC, Chaîne d'Approvisionnement, Sécurité/Sûreté et les opérations des sous-bureaux.
Le Directeur/La Directrice travaille en étroite collaboration avec le Directeur Pays et le Regional Business Service Director. Il/Elle assure la supervision stratégique et garantit l'intégration des fonctions finances et opérations avec la mise en œuvre des programmes. En tant que membre du comité de direction (Senior Management Team - SMT) du bureau pays, il/elle participe aux décisions stratégiques et peut être amené(e) à suppléer le Directeur Pays en son absence.
RESPONSABILITÉS
Assurer le leadership stratégique et l'efficacité organisationnelle
Le/la Directeur/trice Des Finances Et Des Opérations Définit L'orientation Et Assure La Gestion Stratégique De Toutes Les Fonctions Opérationnelles, Incluant Les Achats, La Logistique Et La Distribution, L'administration, Les TIC, La Sécurité Et Les Opérations De Terrain Et Des Bureaux Décentralisés. Ses Responsabilités Incluent
Assurer un leadership stratégique et conseiller l'équipe des opérations.
Développer et organiser un soutien rapide et efficace aux programmes pays pour garantir l'atteinte des objectifs.
Favoriser les liens entre les programmes, les finances, les opérations et le departement "Peuples et Cultures"pour une coordination fluide et un soutien optimal aux programmes.
Veiller à ce que les stratégies financières et opérationnelles soient pleinement intégrées à la stratégie globale du bureau pays.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de direction (SMT) pour s'assurer que les structures en ressources humaines, les systèmes de gestion et les mécanismes de soutien sont appropriés et en place.
Veiller à l'application efficiente et efficace des politiques et procédures.
Gérer la performance, le développement et la gestion des talents.
Renforcer les capacités de l'équipe des opérations et de l'ensemble du bureau pays.
Influencer les méthodes de travail au sein de l'équipe d'appui aux programmes pour améliorer positivement l'efficacité et la valeur ajoutée pour le bureau pays.
Superviser les points focaux des opérations dans les sous-bureaux pour garantir que les systèmes et structures d'appui sont en place et conformes.
Assurer la coordination de la Finance, des Subventions, de l'Audit et de la Gestion des risques
Le Rôle Principal Du/de La Directeur/trice Des Finances Et Des Opérations Est De Développer, Gérer Et Administrer Les Systèmes Financiers Et De Subventions Du Bureau Pays, Tout En Garantissant La Conformité Avec Les Règles De CARE Et Des Bailleurs De Fonds. Ses Responsabilités Incluent
Assurer un enregistrement, une documentation, un contrôle, un suivi et un rapport adéquats des opérations financières.
Superviser les opérations financières quotidiennes et garantir la qualité des services financiers fournis aux programmes, aux projets et au personnel des différentes unités.
Faciliter une collaboration solide entre les services financiers, les programmes et les autres unités du Support.
Assurer l'efficacité des flux des processus financiers et comptables, l'exactitude du traitement des données et des rapports, ainsi que la ponctualité des rapports financiers destinés aux bailleurs de fonds, à la direction et aux autres parties prenantes.
Garantir la conformité du bureau pays avec les règles et règlements des bailleurs de fonds pour toutes les fonctions de soutien aux programmes.
Travailler en collaboration avec la responsable des finances et l'auditrice interne et le responsable de la conformité pour préparer les audits et coordonner les réponses aux audits.
Mettre en œuvre les recommandations d'audit et maintenir des systèmes de contrôle interne solides.
Coordonner l'élaboration des budgets opérationnels du bureau pays et s'assurer que les dépenses sont conformes aux exigences des bailleurs de fonds.
Suivre mensuellement les budgets opérationnels par rapport aux dépenses réelles.
Diriger l'élaboration de l'analyse des risques opérationnels et formuler des recommandations au directeur pays et à l'équipe de direction.
Gerer les opérations (TIC, chaîne d’approvisionnement et sécurité)
Le/la Dircteur/trice Des Finances Et Des Opérations Supervise La Mise En Œuvre Efficace Des Systèmes Et Processus Opérationnels Au Sein De CARE Côte D'Ivoire/Guinée. Cela Inclut
Superviser les fonctions liées aux TIC, aux achats, à la logistique et à l'administration.
Élaborer et réviser les politiques, systèmes et procédures opérationnels en conformité avec les exigences légales de CARE Côte d'Ivoire et celles des bailleurs de fonds.
Superviser la mise en œuvre des initiatives dans le cadre du projet de transformation de la chaîne d'approvisionnement en cours, ainsi que l'application de la nouvelle politique et du manuel de procédures d'achats.
Assurer l'atteinte des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et la soumission des rapports dans les délais impartis.
Fournir des conseils juridiques internes et coordonner avec le service juridique de CARE USA, le bureau régional et le service de gestion des actifs (AMS).
Garantir la conformité aux politiques internes et externes dans tous les domaines opérationnels.
Veiller à la mise en place de systèmes de sûreté et de sécurité dans toutes les zones d'intervention de CARE.
Superviser la responsable de la sûreté et de la sécurité ainsi que les points focaux de sécurité dans les sous-bureaux pour le bureau pays.
S'assurer que les politiques administratives en cas d'urgence sont claires, bien comprises et régulièrement mises à jour.
Participer à l'équipe de planification de la préparation aux urgences (EPP) et veiller à sa mise à jour régulière.
Adjoint de la Directrice Pays, Gestion des sous-bureaux, représentation externe
En Tant Qu'Adjoint à La Directrice Pays, La Directrice/le Directeur Des Finances Et Des Opérations Est Responsable De La Coordination De L'ensemble Des Bureaux Régionaux. Elle/Il Assure Le Soutien Opérationnel Des Projets En Cours. Ses Responsabilités Sont
Assurer la mise en œuvre et le suivi efficaces des activités dans les bureaux régionaux.
Animer des réunions hebdomadaires de coordination entre les programmes, les départements des finances et des opérations.
Superviser les points focaux des opérations dans les bureaux régionaux et veiller au bon fonctionnement des systèmes de soutien dans les bureaux satellites, en particulier lors de situation d'urgence.
Maintenir un contact régulier avec l'Unité de Gestion Régionale (UGR), du Siège et du Share Service Center (SSC) pour résoudre les problèmes nécessitant un soutien externe.
Représenter CARE Côte d'Ivoire/Guinée dans le cadre des interactions avec les institutions gouvernementales et les réseaux professionnels pertinents.
Collaborer et échanger des informations avec les organisations du réseau sur des sujets d'intérêt commun.
Veiller à ce que le Bureau Pays maintienne des relations externes transparentes, professionnelles et cordiales.
Required Qualifications
Formation supérieure : Diplôme de Maitrise - Bacc +4 en finance, comptabilité, administration des affaires, gestion des opérations ou dans un domaine connexe.
Expertise technique : Solide connaissance des principes de gestion financière, des réglementations des bailleurs de fonds et des normes de conformité.
Compétences informatiques : Excellente maîtrise des outils de bureautique (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint) et expérience des systèmes de gestion intégrés (par exemple, PeopleSoft).
Compétences linguistiques : Maîtrise parfaite du français et de l'anglais, à l'oral comme à l'écrit.
Qualités personnelles : Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication.
Valeurs : Adhésion aux principes de travail d'équipe, d'égalité des genres et de gestion participative.
Au moins 10 ans d'expérience en leadership et gestion au sein d'une organisation non gouvernementale internationale (ONGI) ou d'une organisation internationale de grande taille et de grande complexité.
Au moins 5 ans à un poste de direction, de préférence en Afrique francophone.
Expérience approfondie des fonctions opérationnelles, incluant les achats, la logistique, les ressources humaines (RH), l'administration et les technologies de l'information et de la communication (TIC).
Leadership avéré et expérience en renforcement de capacités.
Expérience en formation du personnel financier et non financier.
Capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe, avec de solides compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmes.
Preferred Qualifications
There are individuals who may use CARE’s name and trademark in emails and on websites in an attempt to solicit fees from interested job-seekers. Some examples of these fees are placement fees or immigration processing fees. CARE does not use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an up-front fee of any kind. Occasionally, CARE does employ recruiting or placement agencies to help us identify candidates for specific employment within CARE. If you’re contacted by a legitimate recruiting or placement agency, there should be no charge to you. If you suspect that you have been a victim of fraud from someone purporting to be CARE, please contact us at
legal@care.org
. Please do not email legal@care.org to apply for this position. Instead, click "apply now" below in order to submit your interest.
CARE is an Equal Opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected under applicable law.
Starting salaries are based on internal equity, candidate experience, and the cost of labor where the job is based. Salaries listed only apply to jobs based in the US.

Title: Gouvernant(e) d'étage / Valet de chambre / Femme de chambre
Description:
Missions Principales
Nettoyage et mise en état :
Assurer la propreté complète des chambres (sols, poussière, vitres) et des salles de bain après le départ des clients ou pendant leur séjour.
Literie :
Changer les draps et faire les lits en respectant les standards de l'établissement (méthode du "pliage au carré", etc.).
Approvisionnement :
Réapprovisionner les produits d'accueil (savons, shampoings), le linge propre (serviettes, peignoirs) et le mini-bar.
Signalement :
Rapporter toute anomalie technique (lampe grillée, fuite) ou tout objet oublié par un client via l'application de gestion de l'hôtel.
Missions Secondaires
Contrôle Qualité :
Inspecter minutieusement les chambres après le passage des valets/femmes de chambre pour valider leur remise à la vente.
Encadrement d'équipe :
Distribuer le travail (planning de nettoyage), former le personnel aux méthodes de l'hôtel et veiller au respect des règles d'hygiène et de sécurité.
Gestion des stocks :
Suivre l'état des stocks de linge, de produits d'entretien et de produits d'accueil sur son étage.
Coordination :
Communiquer en temps réel avec la réception pour signaler les chambres prêtes et avec le service technique pour les réparations urgentes.
Compétences et Qualités
Efficacité : Capacité à respecter des temps de nettoyage stricts par chambre.
Discrétion : Respect total de l'intimité et de la confidentialité des clients.
Sens du détail : Repérer la moindre trace ou imperfection.
Endurance physique : Travail debout, déplacements fréquents et port de charges (linge).
Management :
Capacité à motiver et encadrer une équipe diversifiée.
Sens de l'observation :
Un œil d'expert pour garantir le "zéro défaut".
Organisation :
Savoir gérer les priorités (préparer les chambres VIP en priorité, gérer les demandes de dernière minute).
Maîtrise technologique :
Utilisation des logiciels de gestion hôtelière pour la mise à jour des statuts des chambres.

Job Title:
EDUCATION SENIOR TECHNICAL ADVISOR
Job Location(s):
Cote D'Ivoire - Abidjan
JOB SUMMARY:
The Senior Technical Advisor-Education will provide technical guidance to Country Offices, CARE Member Partners (CMPs), and technical units across the Program, Strategy, and Impact (PSI) team, providing input into the design of new initiatives and to the revision of existing approaches, fostering innovation and strengthening overall technical quality. They will ensure that the technical assistance process places a strong emphasis on capacity enhancement of and mutual co-learning with local teams. They will help to integrate new/proven innovative approaches to education and identify synergies with existing programs to avoid duplication and to maximize impact.
In particular, this STA-E will serve as the Project Director (roughly 70% of their time) and provide overall leadership, direction, and management to guide the Re-IMAGINE Project in Niger successfully. RE-IMAGINE aims to test a holistic intervention package that can effectively delay first births among unmarried adolescent girls in Zinder Region.
Specific responsibilities for RE-IMAGINE's Project Director include: (a) Providing strategic guidance for all project operations, including setting up and overseeing work plans/contracts with country office teams and partners; (b) Ensuring quality and timely implementation of interventions according to the project’s work plan; (c) Providing technical leadership to guide the project and facilitate cross-learning with internal and external partners; (d) Maintaining a strong and effective relationship with the donor; (e) Overseeing evaluation design and execution; and (f) Guiding the development of knowledge products, including documentation and dissemination of results through reports, peer reviewed journals, conferences, etc.
In addition, the STA-E will support other projects globally as requested in education and skills. They will also contribute to resource mobilization/program development and engage with donors to generate additional funding for education/girls' empowerment programs. They will help mentor other technical advisors and staff across the organization to ensure program quality and alignment with donor requirements. The STA-E must possess excellent interpersonal, communication and analytical skills, have experience with project management, and be an experienced team leader.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Leadership, Oversight, and Direction Setting
On The RE-IMAGINE Project, The STA-Education Is Expected To:
Oversee the work of a Core Program Management Team (PMT), consisting of CARE Niger's technical advisors and RE-IMAGINE's Program Manager, technical and MEL advisors from Education & Skills team (E&S) team, and technical and MEL advisors from the Global Health (GH) team.
Provide overall leadership for the project’s implementation, alongside counterparts in Niger and relevant staff from the E&S and GH teams, university research partners, and the donor.
Ensure project deliverables and expenditures are on track (aligned with Gantt chart, budget, workplan, and results framework) and that timely mitigation actions are taken and communicated with the donor as needed.
Ensure donor’s feedback to the various versions of the budget are incorporated, and revised versions are resubmitted on time, in collaboration with the PMT members.
Monitor budget implications on changes in timelines, project design, and research design and ensure the donor is informed in a timely manner.
Lead discussions on any budget adjustments that are needed and ensure they are communicated to the donor in a way that balances donor priorities with country office operating realities.
Collaboration, Representation, and Relationship Management
On The RE-IMAGINE Project, The STA-Education Is Expected To:
Lead weekly calls with the PMT members and the CARE Niger team.
Co-lead monthly meetings with the donor and project partners and ensure actions are communicated and followed up on.
Co-lead regular calls with CGE Nigeria to ensure regular communication and engagement to inform ongoing curriculum adaptations as well as exchange visits between the RE-IMAGINE Niger team and CGE Nigeria to inform curriculum adaptations, fidelity of implementation, and ways of working.
Ensure CGE’s Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) is reviewed regularly and updated as necessary based on new agreements.
Represent the technical work and specific grant(s) within internal and external forums which focus on knowledge management, global best practices, and research priorities.
Technical Assistance
The STA-Education is expected to support the RE-IMAGINE Project and other projects as demanded with technical assistance including:
Provide technical assistance to and mentoring of the CO/project staff on best practices related to key programmatic approaches.
Ensure implementation design, work plans, technical reports, and budgets align with donor technical requirements. This should also include the review, quality assurance checks, and signing off on all education related technical deliverables developed and used under RE-IMAGINE.
Collaborate with the Project Manager to develop/update the work plan for all the technical deliverables for all technical approaches (girls’ collectives’ curriculum and facilitator’s guidelines, Social Analysis and Action (SAA) approach adaptation for Niger context; FADA/men’s/boys’ engagement; religious leaders’ training guidelines).
Collaborate with the Project Manager and the Livelihoods Advisor on the consultancy process for completing the market analysis and the development of various training pathways for the girls transitioning from the girls’ collectives.
Ensure that high quality reports and communication materials are submitted to the donor, in partnership with the PMT members and the Relationship Manager, ensuring monitoring and evaluation findings are well-integrated into all donor reporting.
Resource Mobilization
The STA-Education:
Leads resource mobilization and new business development through the development of concept notes, program design, and/or proposals on opportunities that arise aligned with CARE’s Global Strategy, GH and E&S priorities and taking evidence-based key components to scale. This may include technical writing and providing inputs to budget designs to ensure alignment with technical approaches/program design.
Engage with the donor around existing and potential future funding opportunities. This may be during the scoping stage, live bids, and/or donor engagement for continuation of existing funding.
Required Qualifications:
A minimum of 7 to 10 years of relevant professional experience in health and/or education systems strengthening, community-based health programming, adolescent sexual and reproductive health, integrated programming including education, or some combination of these.
Experience in partnership building, collaboration, and negotiation.
Experience working in the West African or similar operating context.
Experience in program management and donor relations.
Strong background in education, health, and/or international development as well as research design and implementation.
Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written formats.
Strong strategic agility and decision-making skills.

Title: Customer Support Representative
Description:
Our mission
We're making Africa the first cashless continent.
In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason—the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.
We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across 9 countries and are growing fast.
Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in...
How You'll Help Us Achieve It
We are going through an extremely exciting period of growth in the Customer Support team and are looking for a Customer Support Representative to join our thrilling journey ahead. Someone who is bordering on obsessive about offering a world-class customer experience and who puts our customers at the heart of everything they do.
Based in The Gambia, you'll be a part of our growing global Customer Support team.
In This Role, You'll
Be responsible for responding to user questions and concerns.
Represent Wave to our users through the call center.
Make outgoing calls to customers.
Answer incoming calls from customers.
Conduct satisfaction surveys.
Know how to report bugs to engineers and escalate when needed.
Knowing how to follow a case until you find a solution.
Coordinate with other departments when Customers or Partners get in touch with you.
Help or inform customers when they have issues.
Key details
Location: Kotu, The Gambia.
Contract Type: 6-month fixed-term contract.
Experience Level: Entry level.
Our salaries are competitive and calculated using a transparent formula. We run performance reviews twice a year and award bonuses to strong performers who have been with the company for more than 6 months.
We offer generous health insurance for yourself and your dependents.
We help you live your fullest life now- we subsidize gym memberships and fitness classes.
Airtime reimbursement.
Free food and a beautiful office space.
Requirements
Fluency in English and Wolof.
At least one year's experience in a comparable position (Call center, Customer Service).
A High school diploma.
Being able to work with flexible schedules.
You might be a good fit if you
Demonstrate tenacity and a willingness to go the distance to get something done.
A strong sense of responsibility and a good ability to take initiative.
Are comfortable defaulting to over-communication and overreaching when it comes to coordination.
Are excessively detail-oriented and seek to achieve excellence in everything you do.
Are client-oriented and have strong interpersonal skills.
Are a diplomatic speaker.
Have a teamwork spirit.
Speak other local languages.
Experience in Customer Service (Mobile wallet or Customer Service Company) or management skills as an added value.
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, Côte d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, Uganda, Niger, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
We are on Y Combinator's top companies by revenue .
How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and a cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.
We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.
Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Technical Advisor
Description:
Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) - is a public-benefit federal enterprise working in more than 100 countries worldwide. We work on behalf of the German Government and support public and private sector clients in a wide variety of areas, including economic development and employment, energy and environment, and peace and security. Our activities cover three priority areas: Energy and Climate, which deals with renewable energy and energy efficiency; Training and Sustainable Growth for decent Jobs; and Peaceful and Inclusive Societies, which focuses on good governance.
Project Brief
The Support to the Private and Financial Sector in Ghana (PFS) aims to improve the employment situation of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises in Ghana. In one key focus area, the program facilitates access to finance for green businesses, creating a pipeline of bankable green projects.
It helps businesses become investment-ready, strengthens their business proposals, and connects them with green financiers. Additionally, the program has collaborated with the Ministry of Finance to develop the first phase of Ghana's Green Finance Taxonomy.
Scope Of Role
We are seeking a Technical Advisor to drive the implementation of green finance initiatives to support the growth of sustainable businesses in Ghana.
Key responsibilities include facilitating access to finance for green projects, building partnerships with financial institutions to promote green lending and investment, and contributing to the development and implementation of green finance policies and regulations
Tasks
Support the development and implement strategies to facilitate access to finance for green projects.
Build strong relationships with financial institutions to promote green lending and investment.
Contribute to the development of innovative financial products and services in green finance.
Contribute to the development and implementation of green finance policies and regulations.
Prepare capacity building support to financial institutions on green finance.
Support cooperation and dialogue with government agencies, the private sector, NGOs, and other stakeholders on the issue of green finance.
Responsible for the preparation and implementation of conferences, workshops, and other events connected to green finance.
Monitor and evaluate the impact of green finance initiatives on economic growth and environmental sustainability.
Ensure knowledge management and knowledge transfer to implementing partners and to external audiences
Qualification Required & Experience
University degree in finance, economics, or a similar subject (advance degree is an advantage)
At least 5 years’ professional experience in the financial sector
Proven experience in sustainable finance, climate finance, or development finance.
Strong understanding of project appraisal and financial instruments.
High level of organizational, communication, reporting, and writing skills
Ability to prioritize and deliver assigned tasks diligently under strict deadlines
Excellent skills in writing and speaking English
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Proficiency in MS Office, ideally MS Office 365.
Willingness to upskill as required by the tasks to be performed – corresponding measures are agreed with management.
Ability to work under pressure of deadlines, high degree of flexibility, attention to detail.
Location:
Accra
How To Apply For The Job
Interested and suitable applicants are to forward their Curriculum Vitae (CV) and a one-page cover letter stating their motivation to the position and added value to the project to:
recruitment-ghana@giz.de
quoting the
Job Code 2024/PFS-TA/23/10
in the subject line. If you do not hear from us two (2) weeks after the deadline, please consider your application unsuccessful.

06 November, 2024
GIZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. All qualified candidates regardless of age, sex, ethnicity, race, and religion are encouraged to apply.

Title: Administrative Assistant (Travel)
Description:
Organizational Setting
The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) contributes to the achievement of the 2030 Agenda through FAO Strategic Framework by supporting the transformation to MORE efficient, inclusive, resilient and sustainable agrifood systems, for better production, better nutrition, a better environment, and a better life, leaving no one behind.The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations is a specialized agency of the United Nations that leads international efforts to defeat hunger.
The Regional Office for Africa (RAF) is responsible for leading FAO’s response to regional priorities for food security, agriculture and rural development through the identification, planning and implementation of FAO’s priority activities in the region. It ensures a multidisciplinary approach to programmes, identifies priority areas of action for the Organization in the Region and, in collaboration with departments and divisions at Headquarters, develops, promotes and oversees FAO's strategic response to regional priorities. RAF also advises on the incorporation of regional priorities into the Organization’s Programme of Work and Budget and implements approved programmes and projects in the region, monitors the level of programme implementation and draws attention to problems and deficiencies. RAF develops and maintains relations with region-wide institutions including the Regional Economic Integration Organizations (REIOs).
The Regional Office supports regional policy dialogue on food security, agriculture and rural development issues, facilitates the emergence of regional partnerships, and supports capacity development and resource mobilization for food security, agriculture and rural development in the region.
The post is located in Accra, Ghana.
Reporting Lines
The Administrative Assistant (Travel) will work under the overall supervision of the Senior Administrative Officer and will work closely with the Administrative Assistant (Travel / Protocol).
Technical Focus
The Administrative Assistant (Travel) will perform a wide range of routine administrative functions in support of the smooth and efficient travel in the RAF Region. He/she will support day-to-day administrative actions, including specialized and complex processes and functions, ensuring consistency, timeliness and conformity with relevant FAO manuals, guidelines and procedures on travel.
Tasks And Responsibilities
Provide travel assistance ensuring the timely delivery of travel arrangements and services, including the application of the organization’s rules and policies to personnel receive relevant entitlements, and that the organization obtains the best service and price for all travel
Prepare, draft, and review correspondence and reports related to travel and recommend improvements for compliance with FAO rules and regulations.
Verify visa requirements, health protocols, and insurance coverage for all travellers.
Request guidance from direct supervisor whenever there is uncertainty regarding policy interpretation, exceptions, or complex travel scenarios.
Monitor FAO Travel Agents in terms of on time booking and ticket issuance and amendments, comparing quotations against the best route and prise. Escalate issues related to delays or non-compliance by travel vendors.
Liaise with the travel initiators and review all travel request with regards to price quotation, itinerary, applicable class of travel etc.
Review supporting documentation for processing affiliate workforce, travel or financial actions in FAO's corporate systems, while ensuring compliance with FAO's rules and regulations.
Draft routine correspondence to verify data, answer queries, and obtain additional information on transactions and financial matters, as required.
Maintain a filing system of travel/administrative documents.
Process payment for tickets issued and ensure timely settlement of travel-related invoices.
During the absence of the RAF Travel/Protocol Administrative Assistant, take appropriate action in the day-to-day work related to travel and brief on return.
Maintain accurate travel data in FAO corporate systems (e.g., GRMS) and ensure proper filing of travel/administrative documents.
Generate periodic reports on travel costs, compliance, and vendor performance for management review.
Provide guidance to staff on FAO travel procedures, entitlements, and documentation requirements.
Perform any other duties as required.
CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING
Minimum Requirements
University degree in Business Administration, Management Hospitality, Tourism, Event Management, or related fields
Two years’ experience in administration, travel administration, financial or administrative support, processing travel claims, managing travel records, or related operational functions within international or similarly structured environments.
Working knowledge (level C) of English
National of Ghana or resident of the country with a valid work permit
FAO Core Competencies
Results Focus
Teamwork
Communication
Building Effective Relationships
Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement
Technical/Functional Skills
Relevant of experience in working with FAO or other UN agencies
Ability to work effectively under pressure, adapt to evolving and complex humanitarian contexts, and operate within multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.
Extent and relevance of experience in computer skills, especially Microsoft Office
Strong written communication skills to deliver effective, positive customer service
Intermediate knowledge (level B) of French is desirable

Title: Technical Advisor
Description:
Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) is a public-benefit federal enterprise working in more than 100 countries worldwide. We work on behalf of the German Government and support public and private sector clients in a wide variety of areas, including economic development and employment, energy and environment, and peace and security. Our activities in Ghana cover three priority areas: Climate and Energy, Just Transition; Sustainable Economic Development, Training and Employment; and Peaceful and Inclusive Societies, which focuses on good governance.
Project Brief
The Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH has been active in Ghana in the context of international development cooperation for more than 30 years. GIZ has been commissioned by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) to implement the Special Initiative “Decent Work for a Just Transition” in Ghana. Due to the constant growth of Africa’s population (population doubles to 2.5 billion people by 2050), the continent needs 20 million new jobs annually. This goal is only achievable in cooperation with the private sector.
Scope Of Role
The Technical Advisor manages the implementation of projects in the field of decent work, in close collaboration with the component and projects teams, especially the decent work technical lead and the head of component.
Tasks
Responsible for working closely with the Decent Work portfolio Technical Lead to oversee, coordinate, and evolve all aspects related to decent work-related advisory services to be extended by the programme.
Responsible for identifying new project opportunities in the area of decent job creation.
Responsible for the quality assurance of ongoing projects per GIZ’s processes and regulations within the field of decent work.
Responsible for working with German and European companies in Ghana other employee groups to ensure the successful
implementation of the Special Initiative.
Responsible for the knowledge exchange with Germany and European countries focusing on decent work and workers councils.
Prepares reports and presentation documents, including monitoring & evaluation, success stories and best practice examples.
Prepares appropriate input for various programme reports including annual reports and contributes to the other reports that may be required.
Coordinate project activities/interventions at local level in consultation with the manager and in cooperation with the partners regarding implementation.
Performs other tasks at the request of management related to the implementation of the project’s objective.
Qualification Required & Experience
University degree in (Master level preferred) Economics, Politics or similar.
At least 3 years’ professional experience with progressing responsibility in a comparable position, professional experience in planning, implementation, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting of projects.
Very good working knowledge of Microsoft 365 Suite applications
Knowledge of labour relations in Germany/Europe
Knowledge of the cooperation with trade unions in Europe/Germany
Diligent, goal oriented, proactive, open minded and innovative, team player and ability to perform tasks without supervision.
Individual good at spotting opportunities, take ownership and can handle cases from start to finish. You have good analytical skills, but you can also work fast and efficiently under pressure.
Strong command of written and spoken English; knowledge of German is an asset
Strong interpersonal skills, work experience in an intercultural environment is an asset
Effective communication skills, humour, ability to engage stakeholders and facilitate networking
Location:
Accra

under the
Job Code 2025/SIJOBS/10/03

Title: National Soil Information and Data Specialist
Description:
Organizational Setting
The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) contributes to the achievement of the 2030 Agenda through the FAO Strategic Framework by supporting the transformation to MORE efficient, inclusive, resilient and sustainable agrifood systems, for better production, better nutrition, a better environment and a better life, leaving no one behind.
FAO is a specialized agency of the UN that leads international efforts to defeat hunger. FAO's goal is to achieve food security for all and ensure that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives. With 195 Members (194 countries and the European Union), FAO works in over 130 countries worldwide.
FAO Country Offices, working under overall corporate guidance and in line with the Strategic Framework, offer policy advice and support to countries in the mandated areas of FAO, facilitated through partnerships, resources and an active country programme to provide technical assistance, develop capacities and deliver core services while fully observing international standards of accountability to establish leadership and strengthen impact at the country level.
The offices deliver on the programmatic priorities of each country as agreed in their respective Country Programming Frameworks (CPFs) aligned to the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) and ensure effective and efficient operations with adequate human and financial resources.
Specifically, FAO Country Offices
advocate, inform and support policies and investments in the areas of FAO’s mandate;
provide technical assistance and deliver core services;
assist and catalyse partnership and resource mobilization activities to support agrifood systems transformation;
position FAO as the specialized/authoritative technical agency in food and agriculture and agrifood systems transformation; and
ensure risk-smart and accountable operations and management.
FAO is implementing the project ‘Soil mapping for resilient agrifood systems in Central America and sub-Saharan Africa (SoilFER) project in Ghana’ – GCP/GLO/1127/USA. The project aligns with FAO’s Programme Priority Areas BP1: innovation for sustainable agriculture production; BP5 ‘Digital agriculture and BE 1: Climate change mitigation and adapted agrifood system, and contribute to SDGs 2.1, 2.4 and 5B.
The position is in the FAO Country Office of Ghana.
Reporting Lines
The National Soil information and Data Specialist will report to the FAO Representative in Ghana, as well as to the project management team in HQ, which is hosted in the NSL.
Technical Focus
Programme soil monitoring system design, implementation, coordination and supervision based on standard international practise and the knowledge of the local conditions, culture, language and institutions of the country of assignment.
Tasks And Responsibilities
Supervise data collection, systematization and harmonization of soil maps and legacy data (in coordination with existing institutions and initiatives in Ghana).
Support the design and supervision of soil surveys and sampling at the national level, using advanced soil survey techniques and methodologies, to generate high-quality soil data and associated metadata, through rigorous quality control and quality assurance measures and in collaboration with the soil laboratory experts
Support the development of digital soil maps, based on soil survey data, and integrating soil data into decision support tools and applications for farmers and local institutions
Support the design and supervision of a soil monitoring system, including the selection of monitoring sites, to be implemented through the establishment of a national soil spectral library and estimation service
Support capacity development in digital soil mapping and modeling
Facilitate the organization of workshops on soil data with stakeholders and partners
Liaise with the project team to ensure timely delivery of survey outputs, including data, maps, scripts, reports and training sessions
Perform any other duties as assigned by the FAO Representative
CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING
Minimum Requirements
University Degree in Agricultural Science, Soil Science, Geographical Information Systems, Computer Science or any related field
At least 3 years of experience in digital mapping and analysis
Working knowledge (Level C) of English
National of Republic of Ghana
FAO Core Competencies
Results Focus
Teamwork
Communication
Building Effective Relationships
Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement
Technical/Functional Skills
Adequate evidence of GIS and other software for mapping at Regional, national or sub-national level
Experience with remote and proximal sensing, and Geospatial analysis technologies
Familiarity with use of GIS software and high-level programming languages like Python and R
Familiarity with digital soil mapping or development of digital maps in general
Familiarity with use of GIS software and high-level programming languages like Python and R
Familiarity with remote and proximal sensing technologies
Familiarity with spatial and non-spatial data analysis, and data visualization
Additional Information
FAO does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process (application, interview meeting, processing)
Applications received after the closing date will not be accepted
Please note that FAO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed at http://www.whed.net/
For additional employment opportunities visit the FAO employment website: http://www.fao.org/employment/home/en/

Title: Program Manager, Ghana
Junior Security Engineer
Description:
Our mission
We're making Africa the first cashless continent.
In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason—the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.
We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across 9 countries and are growing fast.
Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in...
How you'll help us achieve it
Wave is now the largest financial institution in Senegal and Côte d'Ivoire, with millions of users, growing rapidly year-on-year. And, we’re still in the early days of our product roadmap and potential impact on people’s everyday lives.
We’re looking for a keen junior security engineer who’s independent, excited about getting things done, and ready to hit the ground running. You'll primarily be responsible for helping us monitor, tweak, and write new alerts. Secondary responsibilities will include helping product teams patch security holes, or working on smaller projects with the senior Engineers. Our customers trust us with their money, and you’ll be at the forefront of making sure we retain that trust!
The role is ideal for a security professional who enjoys writing code and is interested in hands-on programming as part of their day-to-day work, or for a junior SWE who recently transitioned into security engineering.
Our to-do list changes constantly, but here are some recent projects and activities:
Centralise application-level login and permissions enforcement
Configure and utilise external SIEM solutions to monitor our infrastructure
Help us increase our posture around secret management
Security review of our public-facing APIs
Partner with teams across Wave to define secure guardrails, supporting investigations and incident response
Work with our IT Team to fix any non-conformities found during audits by central banks and ISO certification
Our stack (prior experience is a strong plus, but not required):
backend: Python 3 (+ mypy)
API layer: GraphQL
android frontend: Kotlin/Jetpack
iOS frontend: Swift/SwiftUI
web frontend: TypeScript/React
database: Postgres/CockroachDB
infrastructure: GCP/Terraform
orchestration: Kubernetes
Key Details
This is a fully remote role. Candidates must be based in one of our talent hub countries (UK, Spain, Kenya and Ghana) or in one of our operating markets in Africa including Senegal, Côte d'Ivoire, or Burkina Faso.
Wave provides a yearly $1,200 stipend to support coworking meetups with teammates.
Remote team members are expected to travel to our operational markets (e.g. Senegal or Côte d'Ivoire) at least once a year. Exceptions apply, but we’ve found this key to understanding our users and product.
Our salaries are competitive and are calculated using a transparent formula. For this role, depending on your level and location, we offer a salary of up to $95,100 USD, plus a generous equity package.
Major benefits:
Subsidized health insurance for you and your dependents and retirement contributions (both vary from country to country).
6 months of fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance.
Flexible vacation, with most folks taking between 21-30 days exclusive of statutory holidays.
$10,000 annual charitable donation matching.
Requirements
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience with a minimum of 2 years of it spent in a security-related role.
Strong Experience with Python.
Fluent English.
You might be a good fit if you
Are excited about finding the right balance between security and velocity.
Push through hard problems without giving up.
Have experience remediating non-conformities.
Are excited to work on lots of different security-related work, from audits to code refactors.
Work to make things easier for the next engineer who will touch your code.
Always try to improve as a programmer and colleague.
Are interested in penetration testing or have experience in the field already.
About engineering at Wave
We care about the big picture.
We don’t hire engineers to just ship tickets. We hire them to solve problems. That means caring deeply about outcomes, understanding context, and jumping in wherever something’s broken, even if it’s technically “not your area.” When we see problems, inefficiencies, or opportunities to make something better, we act. We dig into operational issues, clarify fuzzy product specs, or step into unfamiliar code to help unblock teammates.
We move as fast as possible.
Speed matters. It lets us try things quickly, get feedback early, and course-correct while it’s cheap. So we write small PRs. We aim for MVPs. We leave TODOs and file follow-ups. We don’t over-perfect v1. That said, we’re building a financial product. Some things—like money movement, correctness, or security—deserve more caution.
We like boring technology.
We favor tools that are reliable, well-understood, and easy to debug. This keeps us focused on solving meaningful problems instead of wrestling with unpredictable infrastructure. If a new technology helps us move faster, build safer, or solve a real need, we’ll consider it. But we don’t adopt tools just because they’re new—we adopt them because they’re right.
Simplicity is a strategy. It lets us focus our energy where it matters most: serving our users.
Our team
We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, Côte d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, Uganda, Niger, Sierra Leone, and Cameroon plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
We are on Y Combinator's top companies by revenue .
How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and a cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.
We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.
Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Digital & On-Ground Marketer  --(Crypto)
Description:
Summary
The role requires a creative, community-driven marketer with strong communication skills and a solid understanding of blockchain, stable coins, and crypto products. You will support community growth, deliver user education, lead activations, and enhance overall customer experience across digital and offline channels.
Duties
Serve as a primary touchpoint for customer inquiries and issue resolution.
Build and manage online communities across Telegram, X, Discord, and similar platforms.
Create engaging educational content including videos, live sessions, and podcasts.
Execute digital and community campaigns to drive product adoption and awareness.
Partner with marketing to develop content tailored for digital audiences.
Track user feedback and community insights to enhance the customer journey.
Represent at virtual and in-person events.
Oversee social media platforms with market updates and product-focused content.
Lead offline activations to onboard new users and explain crypto use cases.
Support product development and risk controls with user insights.
Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related fields.
2–3 years’ experience in marketing, customer service, or community management (crypto/fintech preferred).
Strong knowledge of blockchain, stable coins, and digital wallets.
Skilled in multimedia content creation.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Experience managing social media and digital communities.
Familiarity with CRM and digital marketing tools.
Ability to run campaigns and maintain a social content calendar.
Experience hosting or coordinating offline community engagements.
Passionate about crypto education and financial inclusion.
Empathetic, customer-first mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
Confident communicator and creative storyteller.
Comfortable on camera and in public-facing engagements.
Self-driven, adaptable, and able to work independently in a remote environment.
Salary, Negotiable
NOTE: Candidate should have experience and knowledge in Crypto/Fintech

Title: Sales Development Representative
Description:
Company Description
Yenhyia is an innovative live event networking platform designed to help attendees forge meaningful connections. With features like virtual queuing, real-time venue density maps, and smart notifications, Yenhyia ensures seamless interactions during events. The platform enables users to connect with desired contacts promptly and eliminates the discomfort of traditional networking. By bridging the gap between virtual and physical networking, Yenhyia maximizes the value of every event interaction.
Role Description
This is a volunteer and remote role as a Sales Development Representative. The individual will focus on identifying and generating new leads, initiating meaningful conversations with potential clients, and nurturing these relationships to create business opportunities. Additional responsibilities include conducting outreach campaigns, qualifying prospects, and supporting the sales team to meet strategic objectives.
Qualifications
Experience in Inside Sales and Lead Generation
Strong Communication and interpersonal skills
Expertise in Sales and Business Development
Organizational and time-management abilities
Ability to work collaboratively in a remote environment
Experience utilizing CRM tools is a plus
Passion for networking technology and event industry is beneficial

Title: Full Stack Software Developer
Description:
🧾 Job Summary:
Waltergates Ghana Limited is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Full Stack Software Developer with strong expertise in backend and frontend technologies, mobile development, DevOps, and cloud environments. The ideal candidate should be proficient in Laravel, React.js, Flutter, MySQL/PostgreSQL database administration, and cloud server deployment using Linux-based VPS environments.
🧠 Key Responsibilities:
·        Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable web applications using Laravel and React.js.
·        Develop and manage cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter.
·        Design and administer MySQL and PostgreSQL databases, ensuring optimal performance and data integrity.
·        Deploy applications on VPS/Linux servers, including configuration and troubleshooting of LAMP/LEMP stacks.
·        Implement CI/CD pipelines, containerization (e.g., Docker), and perform DevOps tasks.
·        Ensure high availability and performance of applications through cloud services (AWS, Azure, or similar).
·        Collaborate with UI/UX designers and backend engineers to implement effective front-end solutions.
·        Maintain code integrity, security, and documentation across projects.
·        Manage version control using Git and deploy updates in a structured development environment.
·        Monitor and optimize system performance, usage, and security.
🧩 Required Skills & Qualifications:
·        Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
·        3+ years of proven full-stack development experience.
·        Strong proficiency in:
- Laravel (PHP framework)
- React.js (Frontend)
- Flutter (Mobile App Development)
- MySQL and PostgreSQL (Database Administration)
- DevOps tools and VPS deployment
·        Experience with Linux server administration and basic shell scripting.
·        Good understanding of RESTful APIs, OAuth, and secure authentication methods.
·        Familiarity with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean).
·        Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.
💼 Preferred Experience (Added Advantage):
·        Experience integrating third-party APIs, SMS, USSD, payment gateways, etc.
·        Knowledge of Agile development and project management tools like Jira or Trello.
·        Familiarity with Microservices Architecture and serverless deployments.
🎯 Personal Attributes:
·        Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
·        Detail-oriented with a passion for writing clean and efficient code.
·        Self-motivated and eager to learn emerging technologies.
·        Strong commitment to deadline and quality delivery.

公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

职位介绍 职责概述： 现金收付、银行结算、日常报销审核工作 岗位要求： 1.会计学、财务管理学相关专业。 2.本科及以上学历。 3.英语CET-4 截止日期：2026年06月30日
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

c. 强迫您入股或者向您集资；
d. 以招聘名义牟取不正当利益；
e. 发布虚假招聘广告信息；
f. 工作时长违反劳动法规定；
g. 存在其他损害您的合法权益的行为。

职位介绍 职责概述： 设备技术改造、项目管理 岗位要求： 1.自动化专业类等相关专业。 2.本科及以上学历。 3.英语CET-4 截止日期：2026年06月30日
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

c. 强迫您入股或者向您集资；
d. 以招聘名义牟取不正当利益；
e. 发布虚假招聘广告信息；
f. 工作时长违反劳动法规定；
