Title: Admin & HR Assistant
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
1. Human Resources Support:
Assist in recruitment processes, including job advertisements, shortlisting, interview coordination, and candidate communications.
Maintain accurate HR records, contracts, leave registers, and personnel files.
Support the onboarding process for new hires, including orientation and documentation.
Process employee benefits, leave requests, and payroll-related data in collaboration with the Finance team.
Ensure compliance with the HR Manual and Puntland Labour Code (Law No. 65).
Assist with performance appraisal processes and maintain related records.
2. Administration Support:
Manage general office administration, including supplies, utilities, and facility maintenance.
Support the preparation of staff communications, memos, and reports.
Handle incoming correspondence, filing, and document control.
Assist with logistics for meetings, trainings, and events.
3. Compliance & Reporting:
Ensure accurate records of staff contracts, leave balances, and HR data.
Support the preparation of HR and admin reports for the Admin, HR & Supply Chain Department Manager.
Assist in compliance with legal requirements such as labour office registration, contract renewals, and health & safety protocols.
4. Employee Relations & Welfare:
Act as a first point of contact for employee queries and concerns.
Support grievance handling and disciplinary processes in line with the HR Manual.
Foster a positive workplace environment through fair treatment, respect, and inclusivity.
How to Apply:
• Only qualified candidates who meet the above requirements are encouraged to apply
and submit their updated CVs by email to careers@hornrg.com
• Email Subject: Application – Admin & HR Assistant

Title: ASIC Verification Engineer
Description: Responsibilities include development of test environments and tests to enable functional verification of large, multi-million gate ASICs.  Additional responsibilities include verification plan development, code coverage analysis, formal equivalency checking, and behavioral modeling.  The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in Verilog and/or VHDL, C/C++, Java, or other programming languages. The qualified candidate will be knowledgeable in industry-standard simulators (VCS, MTI, NC-Verilog), gate-level simulation techniques, and logic debug.  Additional experience with formal verification tools, hardware design and debug, constrained-random verification techniques, and System Verilog is a plus.

Title: Assistance Coordinator
Description:
🌍 Medical Assistance Coordinator - Remote (Based in Tanzania)
We’re Unimedcare, an international medical assistance and TPA company working with insurers and assistance partners across the globe.
As we expand our operations in
East Africa
, we’re looking for a
Medical Assistance Coordinator
based in
Tanzania
to join our growing, fully remote team.
If you’re calm under pressure, people-oriented, and like solving real problems in real time, this one’s for you.
🚑 What You’ll Do
You’ll be on the frontline of our operations, coordinating medical cases for insured patients abroad and making sure everything runs smoothly between all parties involved.
Your day-to-day will include:
Managing medical assistance cases from start to finish.
Coordinating with hospitals, clinics, doctors, and medical providers.
Communicating with insurance companies and international assistance partners.
Following up on cases, timelines, and costs.
Keeping communication clear, fast, and professional, especially in urgent situations.
Making sure patients and partners feel supported at every step.
🧠 What We’re Looking For
Fluent English and Swahili
(required).
Any additional language (especially Spanish) is a
big plus
.
Strong communication skills and a
problem-solving mindset
.
Access to a
stable internet connection
.
Ability to stay organized and composed in high-pressure situations.
Comfortable juggling multiple cases at the same time.
Previous experience in medical assistance, insurance, healthcare coordination, or call centers is a plus, but not a dealbreaker.
🌍 Why Join Unimedcare?
100% remote
role, based in Tanzania.
Work with an international team
across Europe, Africa, and LATAM.
Hands-on role
with real responsibility and impact.
Training, support, and
room to grow
as the company scales.
Competitive compensation
based on experience.
📩 Interested?
Send us your CV and a short intro about yourself.
If you’re reliable, proactive, and excited to work in an international medical assistance environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Mud logging Internship
Description:
About SLB
We are a global technology company, driving energy innovation for a balanced planet. Together, we create amazing technology that unlocks access to energy for the benefit of all.
At SLB, we recognize that our innovation, creativity, and success stem from our differences. We actively recruit people with a diverse range of backgrounds and cultivate a culture of inclusion that unlocks the benefits of our diversity. We want to ensure that everyone feels a sense of belonging here and we encourage, enable, and empower our people to foster inclusivity, build trust, and demonstrate respect for all across the organization.
Global in outlook, local in practice – and with a united, shared passion for discovering solutions, we hire talented, driven people and support them to succeed, personally and professionally
Mud logging Intern
The Mud logging Intern supports in collecting, preparing, and documenting geological rock cuttings and fluid samples. This requires strong attention to detail and strict adherence to safety protocols.
Responsibilities
Assist in collecting drilling cuttings at designated depth intervals under the guidance of experienced personnel.
Support in washing, drying, and preparing samples for geological analysis, including screening and portioning as directed.
Help with labeling, documentation, and proper storage of samples according to established procedures and requirements.
Provide support in maintaining accurate records and logs of sampling activities, including data entry into digital platforms or spreadsheets.
Assist with cleaning and basic upkeep of sampling tools and laboratory equipment, and support routine maintenance checks under supervision.
Offer general assistance to mud loggers, wellsite geologists, and data engineers, including during rig-up/rig-down activities.
Follow all safety regulations and company guidelines while supporting operational tasks.
Communicate promptly with team members to relay observations or anomalies
Experiences & Exposures
Diploma / Certificate in a technical field (2–3 years).
Basic knowledge of geology and drilling processes.
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
Strong commitment to QHSE standards.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Initiative-driven and committed to continuous improvement
Detailed oriented and effective team player
SLB is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Mechanical Fitter
Company: Kioo Limited Dar Es Salaam Tanzania
Location: Dar es-Salaam, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
Description:
Company Description
Kioo Limited, located in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, operates in the electrical and electronic manufacturing industry. Known for its technical expertise, Kioo Limited is a reliable contributor to the manufacturing sector, providing high-quality products and services. The company values innovation and precision to meet the demands of a dynamic and evolving industry. With a dedicated team and a focus on excellence, Kioo Limited continues to support regional and international clients.
Role Description
This full-time on-site role is based in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. As a Mechanical Fitter, you will be responsible for fitting, assembling, and maintaining machinery to ensure operational efficiency. Daily tasks include conducting preventive maintenance, repairing mechanical systems, and ensuring proper function of machinery and equipment. You will work closely with a team to address mechanical issues and contribute to the overall performance of manufacturing processes.
Qualifications
Proficiency in Machining, including the use of tools and techniques for creating machine parts.
Expertise in Preventive Maintenance and Maintenance to ensure optimal operation of mechanical systems.
Strong skills in Fitting, with the ability to assemble and install mechanical components effectively.
Experience in working with a variety of Machinery, including troubleshooting and repair.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and adapt to a dynamic work environment.
Technical certification or relevant vocational training in Mechanical Fitting or a related field is advantageous.
Prior experience in an industrial or manufacturing setting is preferred.

Title: ICM MANAGER
Description:
ICM Manager
Dekker Chrysanten | hbo wo | Moshi, Tanzania
Geplaatst: 24/12/2025
Apply directly
Save as favorite
More at Dekker Chrysanten B.V.
prevnext
12
Zoek jij een uitdagende baan in het buitenland met veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor ontplooiing? Heb jij een stevige persoonlijkheid en een groot doorzettingsvermogen? Vind jij het leuk om met gevoel voor culturen te werken in een modern glasbedrijf?
Nederland is wereldwijd gezien de grootste speler in de sierteelt. We behoren internationaal gezien tot de grootste veredelaars en vermeerderaars van de chrysant. Continu vernieuwen we het assortiment met aantrekkelijke rassen. Zo houden we de focus van de consument op de chrysant vast. Dat doen we niet alleen in eigen land, maar mondiaal via distributeurs en eigen verkoopkantoren. Onze productielocaties in Hensbroek en Tanzania voorzien klanten in grote delen van de wereld van chrysantenstekken.
Met een team van ruim 1.000 medewerkers, waarvan 170 op de locatie in Hensbroek, werken we er elke dag aan om de volgende stap te zetten. Als groeiend familiebedrijf, opererend in een dynamische wereld, zoeken we talent om ons verder te brengen. Ben jij zo iemand, als ICM Manager voor onze productielocaties in Tanzania?
Dit wordt jouw uitdaging
In deze rol geef je richting aan de Integrated Crop Management-strategie en is het doel om het chemisch middelengebruik met meer dan 90% terug te dringen, terwijl je de hoge kwaliteits- en productiestandaarden behoudt.
Je vertaalt visie naar praktijk, stimuleert innovatie en bouwt aan een deskundig team dat werkt aan een duurzame en toekomstbestendige teelt. Je rapporteert in deze functie aan de General Manager.
Deze taken kunnen wij aan jou overlaten
Ontwikkel een langetermijnvisie voor ICM die aansluit bij de duurzaamheidsdoelen van Dekker Chrysanten, waarbij nauwe samenwerking met de farmteams centraal staat.
Richt de strategie op het minimaliseren van chemisch middelengebruik en stem innovaties voortdurend af met de productieprocessen voor optimale kwaliteit en efficiëntie.
Selecteer en evalueer geschikte biologische bestrijders en biostimulanten voor de drie farms in Tanzania en vertaal R&D-resultaten uit Nederland naar toepasbare oplossingen op locatie.
Werk samen met farm-leiding en teeltteams voor draagvlak en effectieve implementatie, adviseer over inzet van middelen en analyseer ICM-data voor rapportages en verbeterplannen.
Train en coach lokale IPM-technici en scouts, stimuleer een data gedreven teamcultuur, en werk samen met leveranciers voor verdere optimalisatie. Deel actief resultaten en ervaringen binnen het internationale netwerk, met nadruk op samenwerking en acceptatie voor succes.
Dit verwachten wij van jou
HBO/WO-opleiding in een agrarische of groene richting.
Minimaal 5 jaar relevante ervaring in een teeltomgeving.
Kennis van natuurlijke vijanden, bodemschimmels en microbiële middelen.
Ervaring met duurzame teeltsystemen, verandermanagement en training van lokale teams.
Analytisch sterk en praktisch ingesteld, met inzicht in tropische teeltomstandigheden.
Communicatief vaardig, in staat om ICM-principes helder over te brengen.
Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
Ervaring met Excel en andere datatools.
Samenwerkingsgericht, innovatief, flexibel en cultureel sensitief.
Wat mag je van ons verwachten?
Bij Dekker Chrysanten krijg je veel zelfstandigheid en wordt initiatief gewaardeerd. Je werkt in een stimulerende sfeer, ontvangt een marktconform salaris en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals verzekeringen, huisvesting, vervoer en vergoeding van schoolkosten. Je hebt een betekenisvolle rol binnen een innovatief familiebedrijf, met veel ruimte voor eigen ontwikkeling en samenwerking met Nederlandse specialisten. Wonen en werken in Tanzania biedt uitstekende faciliteiten en een aantrekkelijk expat-pakket.
Wij zijn benieuwd naar jou!
Solliciteer als je denkt dat jij onze toekomstige ICM Manager Tanzania te zijn. Indien je nog meer wilt weten over deze functie en/of vragen hebt, bel dan naar 0226 – 45 60 60 en vraag naar Dick Beelen, Productie Manager.
Back
Apply directly
Save as favorite
More at Dekker Chrysanten B.V.

Any commercial activities concerning this advertisement will not be appreciated.

Title: Barista
Description:
Company Description
Emirates Leisure Retail (ELR), a subsidiary of the Emirates Group, operates a diverse portfolio of over 280 outlets, offering exceptional dining and retail experiences in the UAE, Australia, and across thirteen domestic and international airports. Founded in 2007, ELR manages a combination of franchise and own-brand models, featuring iconic global names such as Costa Coffee, Pret A Manger, and The Kitchen by Wolfgang Puck. Committed to quality and innovation, ELR prides itself on delivering premium experiences at great value. The company’s success is driven by the talent and dedication of its team, providing excellent growth opportunities in a dynamic environment.
Role Description
This is a full-time, on-site Barista position located in Airport, MO. As a Barista at Emirates Leisure Retail, you'll prepare and serve high-quality coffee and beverages, assist with food preparation, and ensure cleanliness and organization of the station. You will provide exceptional customer service by engaging with patrons, taking orders, and addressing any inquiries or concerns. Additionally, you will ensure that company standards and health regulations are strictly maintained at all times.
Qualifications
Demonstrated Barista skills, including beverage preparation and the ability to operate coffee machines
Strong Interpersonal Skills and excellent Communication to engage effectively with team members and customers
Customer Service expertise to ensure customers have a positive experience
Food Preparation knowledge to handle and present food in line with company standards
Attention to detail, ability to multitask, and organizational skills
Previous experience in a hospitality or retail environment is advantageous
Flexibility to work in shifts and adapt to a fast-paced environment

Title: Emulsion Plant Operator
Description:
Position Description
The Barrick North Mara Team
is seeking to recruit a
Emulsion Plant Operator
to join and grow our team.
Join Our Exceptional Team And Embody Barrick's Core Values As You Work With Us. We Are In Search Of Individuals Who Can Champion Barrick's DNA By
Communicating Honestly, Transparently, and Acting with Integrity
Exhibiting a Results-Driven approach
Delivering solutions that are Fit for Purpose
Dedicating themselves to Building a Sustainable Legacy
Taking Responsibility and being Accountable
Committing to Zero Harm
Cultivating strong and meaningful Partnerships
If you're ready to contribute to our
world-class team
while embracing these values, we encourage you to apply and become a valued member of our diverse workforce.
Responsibilities
Compliance with SHES charter
Ensure adherence to all SHES policies, procedures, and standards to safeguard company personnel and assets
Demonstrate safe behavior & leadership.
Compliance with ANE manufacture and plant operating procedures, including work permits, confined space entry, control of change, PPE application, record keeping and security management and employee handbook.
Participate in SHES programs.
Enforcement of the requirements of the relevant Statutory regulations, SHES Policy and the Mine Standards.
Ensuring that all accidents in the department are immediately notified to the Supervisor.
Prepare, maintain and present, when required
Good communication with Quality Control and address any problem immediately.
Active participation in drafting and revision of operating procedures.
Maintain timekeeping.
Maintain proper housekeeping.
Take full accountability by maintaining good safety practices and following environmental policies in the emulsion bay perimeter.
Train new employees.
Ensure adherence to legal and company policies and procedures
Active participation in site meetings, and demonstrable cooperation with Barrick and Contractors staff at site.
To carry out any other reasonable duties within the overall function of the job.
To maintain inventory records of all raw materials, waste and provide ANE manufacturing and transfer operations safely within the guidelines set out in Barrick SOPs for ANE Manufacturing and Reload Depots and relevant Tanzanian Regulations.
Qualification Requirements And Competencies
Mining technician knowledge
Blasting certificate
Self-starter
Team player
Knowledge of chemical and explosive handling is preferred
Understanding Kiswahili and English language is a must.
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Stress management skills
Time management skills
Ability to motivate
Safety Orientated
Ability to analyse data and transfer it into action plans
Alignment and leadership
Developing others
Ready to work above working hours
What We Can Offer You
A comprehensive compensation package including bonuses and site-specific benefits
The ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to grow and learn with the industry colleagues are endless
Access to a variety of career opportunities across the organization

Title: Sales Officer (x4)
Description:
Company Description
Mantle Management Consultants (MMC) is a Uganda-based international consulting firm dedicated to supporting Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs), Non-profit and Development organizations in East Africa and around the world. MMC specializes in Non-Profit consulting, business advisory, financial management, digital transformation, and capacity development, aligning its initiatives with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Serving a range of clients such as MSMEs across agriculture, manufacturing, education, and technology, along with NGOs and start-ups, MMC delivers tailored solutions physically in East Africa and globally through online platforms. Guided by values of excellence and integrity, MMC is committed to fostering sustainable business growth and innovation through expert consulting and global partnerships.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site position for a Sales Officer based in Kampala. The Sales Officer will be responsible for driving business development initiatives, generating and converting leads, building and maintaining strong customer relationships, and managing sales operations. The individual will work closely with channel partners and internal teams to meet sales targets and ensure client satisfaction.
Qualifications
Strong skills in Customer Service and Communication
Experience in Lead Generation and Sales Operations
Knowledge and expertise in Channel Sales and relationship management
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment
Proficiency in technology tools and software to enhance sales effectiveness
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field
Prior experience in sales, especially in key sectors such as hospitality, engineering, agriculture, manufacturing, or services, is an advantage
Commitment to achieving sales targets and delivering exceptional customer experiences

Facility

Summary
Ensure optimum patient flow through the office; accurate and prompt entry submission of charges; initiation of new patient medical records; accurate, efficient scheduling of patient visits and timely submission of reports.

Major Job Functions
The Following Is a Summary Of The Major Essential Functions Of This Job. The Incumbent May Perform Other Duties, Both Major And Minor, That Are Not Mentioned Below. In Addition, Specific Functions May Change From Time To Time:
Ensure completion of new patient information packet including consents, insurance forms and other clinical documents
Verify and update computer system with patient demographic and insurance information
Schedule appointments for follow-up visits and procedures in the computer system
Determine the appropriate provider, length and time of appointment
Accurately post charges in the computer system to the proper patient account
Collect and post payments from patients and prepare patient receipts
Maintain and responsible for cash drawer (batch) and balances and closes cash drawer
Answer basic questions about patients’ bills and insurance

Close and secure office at the end of shift
Other duties as assigned

Title: Chef de groupe VO (H/F)
Description:
Avec plus de 30 concessions et plus de 15 marques, Sipa Automobiles est le distributeur automobile multimarques du grand Sud-Ouest.
Depuis les années 60, nous consacrons notre énergie et nos compétences à un seul et unique métier : l'automobile.
Nous comptons aujourd'hui plus de 760 collaborateurs qui s'attachent à promouvoir des valeurs fortes de proximité, de service et de performance.Nous recherchons un Chef de groupe VO (H/F) pour notre nouvelle concession BYD - Sipa Automobiles - Mérignac. Vous serez entièrement autonome sur la gestion du parc Véhicules d'Occasion. Votre rôle sera stratégique pour assurer la performance commerciale et la rentabilité du service VO.
Vos missions principales :
Gestion complète du parc VO : organisation, présentation et suivi des véhicules.
Pilotage et réalisation des ventes VO : mise en place des actions commerciales, suivi des objectifs.
Gestion des reprises et achats VO : évaluation, négociation et intégration au stock.
Suivi du stock VO : optimisation des rotations, contrôle des marges et des délais.
Reporting et analyse des performances : suivi des indicateurs et propositions d'amélioration.
Le poste est à pourvoir du lundi au samedi avec un jour de récupération dans la semaine. Vous avez une solide expérience dans la gestion des véhicules d'occasion en concession. Idéalement, vous avez déjà travaillé en autonomie complète sur un parc VO. Organisé(e) et orienté(e) résultats, vous maîtrisez les outils informatiques et savez piloter vos indicateurs. Votre sens du commerce et votre capacité à prendre des initiatives feront la différence.
Nos nombreuses implantations dans le Sud-Ouest nous permettront de vous accompagner tout au long de votre carrière.
Nous proposons un système de rémunération et d'avantages attractifs composés :
d'un salaire fixe et d'un variable motivants,
d'une voiture de fonction avec carte essence,
d'un téléphone portable,
de tickets restaurants,
d'une mutuelle et prévoyance,
du noël collaborateurs,
d'une participation employeur à votre abonnement transport en commun
de tarifs préférentiels collaborateurs (achats, maintenance et pièces),
d'un système de prime de cooptation,
des avantages IRP auto (participations aux vacances, abonnements sportifs et culturels ...)...
Notre entreprise valorise la diversité et l'inclusion. Nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap. N'hésitez pas à solliciter à ce sujet notre référente Handicap lors de votre candidature afin d'en savoir plus sur notre politique handicap et les mesures d'adaptation possibles.

Title: Site Trainer - Mopani
Description:
We are a global technology company developing innovative solutions for mining, tunnelling, and construction, improving project safety, environmental impact, and productivity. We offer premium equipment, all-round aftermarket services and high-quality chemicals and rock support as our core products to our customers. We operate globally in over 30 countries with more than 1,800 experts. At Normet, we commit to a culture founded in our Values - Caring, Committed & Courageous. We foster your talent, with us you shine.
Job Description – Site Trainer (Mopani)
Job Title : Site Trainer
Department :
Normet Africa Service
Reporting to :
Site Operations Manager
Key Relationships :
Customers, Employees, Global teams interactions HSEQ.
Job Summary
The Normet Site Trainer is responsible for planning, coordinating, and delivering comprehensive theoretical and practical training programs on the operation, maintenance, and safety protocols of Normet's machinery. This role involves conducting training by ensuring Mopani can leverage the full potential of their equipment while adhering to all relevant safety and regulatory standards.
Responsibilities
Conduct technical product training & operator training for customers and internal teams
Collaborating with training divisions within the Group to optimise Operator & Technical training offerings
Develop and maintain technical documentation and training materials
Engage with the customer by selling services and solutions
Identify and prioritize product improvements based on customer feedback and from Engineering teams
Work closely with the product and engineering teams to communicate customer needs and feedback
Stay up-to-date with the latest product features and machine capabilities
Qualifications And Experience
Matric / Grade 12
National Diploma in Electrical /Mechanical / Electronics Engineering or Diesel Mechanic Technician Certificate
Valid Facilitator and Moderator certification.
Minimum 3 years of post studies work experience related to Operator & Technical training and development of technical solutions on mining equipment, preferably Normet.
Skills And Competencies
Normet equipment knowledge
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Accuracy and attention to detail is vital
Strong computer literacy (MS Office Suite, potentially LMS platforms and OEM diagnostic software).
Other Requirements
Physical fitness to work in mining environments, including underground settings.
Able to work under pressure, prioritize, multi- tasks and meet tight deadlines
Come and share your courage to shine with us!
Visit our career website for more information.

Title: Mobile Application Developer
Description:
Company Description
We suggest you enter details here.
Role Description
This is a full-time hybrid role for a Mobile Application Developer. The role is based in Mufulira with the flexibility for some remote work as needed. The responsibilities include designing, developing, and maintaining cutting-edge mobile applications, troubleshooting and debugging to optimize app performance, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver user-friendly and efficient solutions. The candidate will also be responsible for adhering to best practices in mobile app development and testing systems to ensure code quality and functionality.
Qualifications
Expertise in Mobile Application Development and Mobile Applications
Proficiency in Application Development processes and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles
Experience in iOS Development and related technologies
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience working collaboratively in a team environment
Ability to adapt to a hybrid working model with on-site and remote tasks
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Familiarity with Agile development practices is a plus

Title: Asset Accountant
Description:
Job Purpose
The Asset Accountant is responsible for maintaining accurate accounting records and controls over inventory, fixed assets and company owned company operated sites.
The role ensures compliance with company policies, accounting standards (e.g., IFRS), and statutory requirements while supporting business operations with timely and reliable reporting.
Principal Accountabilities:
OU Finance Focal point for all Stocks, Fixed Assets at company owned and company operated sites
Ensuring that own and 3rd party physical stocks are reconciled on a daily/weekly basis depending upon location. Also, co-ordinating the annual physical stock take.
Monitor slow-moving, obsolete, and damaged stock, ensuring appropriate provisions are made
Review, monitor stock movements and work closely with operations and warehouse teams to strengthen internal controls
Preparation of daily/weekly/month end Cash, Stocks, Sales and Fixed Assets reconciliation for Company owned company operated sites
Keeping update with IFRS especially IAS16 and IFRS 16 and ensuring the OU is fully compliant
Checking accounting entries for WIP and Fixed Asset transfers and reclassifying these as required.
Liaising with budget holders to determine the completion status of projects and deciding when to transfer expenditure from WIP to completed assets
Process disposals, retirements, transfers, and write-offs of assets, ensuring compliance with MOA
Monitoring expenditure and progress against approved capex budgets and preparing reports for budget holders on this.
Periodic cost reviews with the CoB Managers- covering capital expenditure by project and preparing reports for budget holders on this.
Participating in asset verification/tagging exercises and updating fixed asset registers as a result of these.
Post relevant journal entries relating to stock adjustments and fixed asset transactions
Assist with month-end and year-end closing processes
Liaising with external/internal auditors on any/all of the above.
Such other tasks or duties as may be allocated to him/her by the Finance Controller or Finance Manager
Requirements
Finance degree, Accounting, Finance degree (or any related degree) or qualified accountant
Finance, OU and OP experience
Good systems skills and knowledge of ERP (preferably SAP) processing systems
Fluent in English
Good communications, influencing and networking skills
Closing Date: 10 December 2025

Title: Painter-Fixed Term Contract
Description:
Company Description
Contemporary, relaxed and imaginative. Be it a leisurely family break or romantic escape, Avani Gaborone Resorts & Casino provides the right space for guests who value the details that matter.
Avani is a brand that’s social-at-heart. It beats with energy, creativity, friendliness and spontaneity. Avani spaces and service style, the Food & Beverage, Leisure and Business offerings, our communications – all of them exude a social vibe. This social core inspires the development process, operational innovations, recruitment and training, and marketing initiatives.
Job Description
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Painter to join our team in Gaborone, Botswana. As a Painter in our organization, you will be responsible for preparing and painting various surfaces to enhance and protect buildings and structures throughout the city. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, excellent color-matching abilities, and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Prepare surfaces for painting by cleaning, sanding, and applying primer as needed
Mix and match paint colors to meet specific requirements and maintain consistency
Apply paint, stain, and other finishes to interior and exterior surfaces using brushes, rollers, and sprayers
Perform touch-ups and repairs on existing painted surfaces
Maintain a clean and organized work area, ensuring proper care of tools and equipment
Adhere to safety protocols and wear appropriate personal protective equipment
Collaborate with other team members and trades to complete projects efficiently
Provide excellent customer service by communicating clearly with clients and addressing their concerns
Estimate time and material requirements for projects
Stay updated on new painting techniques and products to improve efficiency and quality
Qualifications
Proven experience as a Painter, with a strong portfolio of completed projects
In-depth knowledge of painting techniques, color theory, and various paint types and their applications
Excellent attention to detail and ability to produce high-quality, consistent results
Strong problem-solving skills to address unexpected issues that may arise during projects
Physical stamina and ability to work at heights, bend, and stand for extended periods
Proficiency in using painting tools and equipment, including sprayers, sanders, and scaffolding
Excellent time management and organizational skills to meet project deadlines
Strong communication skills to interact effectively with team members and clients
Flexibility to work on various job sites within Gaborone and adapt to changing project requirements
Safety-conscious mindset with a commitment to following proper safety procedures
High school diploma or equivalent (preferred)
Vocational training or apprenticeship in painting (preferred)
Valid driver's license and reliable transportation
Basic math skills for calculating material requirements and measuring surfaces
Ability to read and interpret blueprints and project specifications (a plus)
Additional Information
Avani leaders try new approaches and challenge the status quo; they recognise that the hotel industry is rapidly changing and that what worked today is simply not good enough for tomorrow. Our teams and guests are looking for fun, original, meaningful and intentional experiences and our leaders are key to uncovering this.

Title: Manager
Description:
Management Level
Manager
Job Description & Summary
At PwC, our people in audit and assurance focus on providing independent and objective assessments of financial statements, internal controls, and other assurable information enhancing the credibility and reliability of this information with a variety of stakeholders. They evaluate compliance with regulations including assessing governance and risk management processes and related controls.
In financial statement audit at PwC, you will focus on obtaining reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor’s report that includes the auditor’s opinion.
Enhancing your leadership style, you motivate, develop and inspire others to deliver quality. You are responsible for coaching, leveraging team member’s unique strengths, and managing performance to deliver on client expectations. With your growing knowledge of how business works, you play an important role in identifying opportunities that contribute to the success of our Firm. You are expected to lead with integrity and authenticity, articulating our purpose and values in a meaningful way. You embrace technology and innovation to enhance your delivery and encourage others to do the same.
Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:
Analyse and identify the linkages and interactions between the component parts of an entire system.
Take ownership of projects, ensuring their successful planning, budgeting, execution, and completion.
Partner with team leadership to ensure collective ownership of quality, timelines, and deliverables.
Develop skills outside your comfort zone, and encourage others to do the same.
Effectively mentor others.
Use the review of work as an opportunity to deepen the expertise of team members.
Address conflicts or issues, engaging in difficult conversations with clients, team members and other stakeholders, escalating where appropriate.
Uphold and reinforce professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), the Firm's code of conduct, and independence requirements.
Minimum years experience required
Additional application instructions
Travel Requirements
Up to 100%
Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?
Yes
Job Posting End Date
December 30, 2025

Title: Travel Sales Consultant - Expression of Interest - Horsham
Description:
Attention Travellers, Your Search for the Perfect Job Ends Here!
Soon, you'll land a role where you’re encouraged to share your passion for travel and open up the world for our customers. The atmosphere is warm, welcoming, and rewards the bold and brave. Leave your ego at the door and bring along your drive, determination, and resilience. You might hit some bumps along the way, but you'll have the full support of your team. So buckle up and read on… your next adventure awaits!
Expression of Interest
We’re always on the lookout for amazing talent! This
Expression of Interest
is your opportunity to let us know you’re interested in joining Flight Centre. While we may not have an immediate opening, we’d love to connect with experienced travel consultants who are ready to take their career to the next level when the right opportunity arises.
Your First-Class Employee Benefits
Earn More from Day One: Base wage plus uncapped incentives – earn a percentage of every sale from day one, with no limit on what you can achieve.
Great Earnings: The average OTE (on target earnings) for a Travel Consultant in their first 12 months are £35,000.
Travel Like a Pro: Access industry travel discounts and qualify for sponsored ‘Familiarisation Trips’ to explore new destinations and products around the world.
Career Growth: Be supported in your career growth through our Brightness of Future pathways within our global organisation.
Celebrate Success: Embrace our famous company culture at Reward & Recognition events throughout the year, including our annual ‘Global Gathering’ (pack your bags for LA 2025!).
Be Yourself: Thrive in a workplace that values individualism – come as you are!
Stay Healthy: Benefit from our Health Cash Plan - claim cash reimbursements for routine and emergency healthcare and work station assessments. Top of Form
Stay Active: Enjoy an hour out of your working week dedicated to being active or focusing on your wellbeing.
What It Takes To Be Part Of Our Team
Travel Expert: You’re the go-to person in your circle for travel recommendations, tips, and tricks.
Innovative Thinker: You seek out new ways to build on your success and think outside the box to find the best travel solutions for your customers.
Sales-focused: You believe hard work should be rewarded, so you’re focused on achieving your KPIs and sales targets to get the incentives you deserve.
Organised: You understand the importance of organisation and managing your time effectively to achieve the best results and stay on top of your work.
Multitasker: You’re good at the people stuff and the behind-the-scenes stuff too – building itineraries, creating invoices, operating our booking systems, and multitasking with a customer in front of you.
How You’ll Open Up the World for Our Customers
Create Dream Itineraries: Build dream trips for your customers, creating lasting memories they’ll share for years to come.
Share Your Knowledge: Use your travel expertise to make perfect recommendations from a range of options including flights, accommodation, cruises, tours, insurance, and more.
Roll Out the Red Carpet: Make your customers feel welcomed and valued through active listening, mutual respect, and a positive attitude.
Trusted Advisor: Be someone your customers can trust and share their excitement with, showing them you take your business seriously but not yourself.
Don’t Miss Out!
Apply now for one of the best adventures you’ll ever have.
Our fantastic work perks include
Uncapped earning potential - starting retainer of £24,000 (commission model is uncapped, meaning earning potential is huge)
Training and mentorship – you will undergo a fully supported training program and have access to ongoing mentorship and support.
Discounted travel for family and friends booked by our in-house travel team – as part of Flight Centre Travel Group, you have access to industry rates and discounts for you and your friends and family.
Career progression – as part of Flight Centre Travel Group with a global brand network spanning 30+ brands and 20+ countries you are empowered to create clear career pathways and have access to the training and support needed to achieve your goals.
Fun culture with industry-renowned social events (think monthly award nights, global conferences, end-of-financial year balls + more).
So much more (company-matched charitable giving, excellent pension scheme, an active hour each week etc.)Dedicated in-house travel team for incredibly discounted trips including family and friend
Our number one philosophy is Our people. Flight Centre Travel Group's promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which reflects the diversity of our society.
We welcome accommodation requests to help make our hiring and onboarding experience as accessible as possible. Please advise us about accommodation needs at any point by contacting our Recruitment Team at RecruitmentUK@flightcentre.co.uk .
#FCB

Title: Bulk Cashiers X17- Gaborone
Description:
BULK CASHIERS X17 -GABORONE
Key Responsibilities
Processing and verifying deposits received from customers.
Proper use of automated machinery as required.
Balancing off of daily cash (Inter-teller).
Issuing cash change as per customer change requisitions.
Carrying out such other related duties as directed by the supervisor.
Following well-defined procedures to ensure the security of cash.
Qualifications & Experience
Minimum certificate in Accounting and Business Studies.
Previous Cash Handling and (Or)banking experience.
Attributes/Competencies
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Self-motivated, well organized and able to work well within a team environment
Assertive yet flexible
Strong customer service ethics
Ability to take initiative
Honest and reliable

Title: Driver
Description:
Organizational Setting
The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations. With presently 194 member states, and working in more than 130 countries worldwide, including Namibia. FAO contributes to the achievement of the 2030 Agenda through the FAO Strategic Framework by supporting the transformation to MORE efficient, inclusive, resilient, and sustainable agrifood systems, for better production, better nutrition, a better environment, and a better life, leaving no one behind.
The main of the FAO Country offices, which are headed by an FAO Representative, is to assist governments to develop policies, programmes and projects to achieve food security and to reduce hunger and malnutrition, to develop the agricultural, fisheries and forestry sectors, and to use their environmental and natural resources sustainably. FAO Country Office activities include the design and implementation of country-specific field programs, liaison with local donors' representatives, and active outreach activities related to FAO initiatives.
Reporting Lines
Under the overall supervision of the FAO Representative in Namibia and direct to the Assistant FAO Representative – Administration.
Technical Focus
The Driver is responsible for driving the Country Office Staff of FAO Representations and visitors. He/she also provides other transportation-related and messenger services for the Country Office Staff of FAO Representations/Regional Offices.
Tasks And Responsibilities
Drive the country office staff and their official visitors on official trips and drive for the FAO Representative and his/her visitors on occasions as necessary: observing road safety rules and UNDSS & FAO guidelines;
Meet staff and official visitors at the airport, facilitate immigration and customs formalities, hotel check-in and other local formalities;Log official trips in/or out of the country;
Ensure day-to-day maintenance of the assigned vehicle(s) checks oil, water, battery, tires, etc.; perform minor repairs and timely arrange for any other repairs necessary to keep the vehicle safe and technically sound at all times; maintain the vehicle(s) in a clean condition;
Handle local and organizational formalities when involved in an accident, ensure that in this case all organization and local/country rules, regulations and procedures are followed correctly;
Check service dates and make necessary bookings for the service, collect the vehicle after the service and make necessary payment for additional repairs if applicable.
Handle local and organizational formalities when involved in an accident, ensure that in this case all organization and local/country rules, regulations and procedures are followed correctly;
Collect and deliver mail, documents, pouches, and other communications/items from and to the country office: go to the post office, airport, government agencies, other UN agencies, institutions, project sites, etc., to take and deliver items and communications; keep records as required;
Performs any other duties that may be assigned
CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING
Minimum Requirements
Secondary school education
Clean Driving Licence
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a driver, Flawless and safe driving record.
Fluent in both written and spoken English and other UN languages is a plus.
National of Namibia
FAO Core Competencies
Results Focus
Teamwork
Communication
Building Effective Relationships
Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement
Job Posting
18/Dec/2025
Closure Date
01/Jan/2026, 10:59:00 PM
Organizational Unit
FRNAM
Job Type
Non-staff opportunities
Type of Requisition
PSA (Personal Services Agreement)

IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please note that Closure Date and Time displayed above are based on date and time settings of your personal device
FAO seeks gender, geographical and linguistic diversity in order to best serve FAO Members in all regions.
FAO is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality, background and culture
Qualified female applicants, qualified nationals of non-and under-represented Members and person with disabilities are encouraged to apply
Everyone who works for FAO is required to adhere to the highest standards of integrity and professional conduct, and to uphold FAO's values
FAO, as a Specialized Agency of the United Nations, has a zero-tolerance policy for conduct that is incompatible with its status, objectives and mandate, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination
All selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks
All applications will be treated with the strictest confidentiality

Not specified

Trainee Financial Advisor

Permanent

Sales

International

Oshakati
Introduction
Momentum Metropolitan Namibia i seeking for a qualified Trainee financial Advisor to join Oshakati team.
Disclaimer
As an applicant, please verify the legitimacy of this job advert on our company career page.
Role Purpose
Attract, acquire and retain clients by selling company products to generate new business and to provide after sales service to clients to ensure client retention, increase market share and contribute to the overall business objectives and its longterm viability.
Requirements
Matric/Grade 12
A Degree in Marketing/Business Management or an equivalent qualification

Title: Global Field Service Specialist - HPGR
Description:
Join an industry leader and make a positive change in the sustainable use of the world’s natural resources. Together, we will transform the business and drive the industry toward a greener future.
At Metso, you will be supported by our inclusive culture and a network of colleagues from around the world. With us, you will embark on a personal growth journey and are encouraged to realize your potential. This is your invitation to rise above the possible.
Job posting end date: 01/07/2026
Who we are?
Metso is a frontrunner in sustainable technologies, end-to-end solutions and services for the aggregates, minerals processing and metals refining industries globally. We improve our customers’ energy and water efficiency, increase their productivity, and reduce environmental risks with our product and process expertise.
Our Global Organisation strives on positive change to our World by offering sustainable solutions for their Mining equipment. Our people are highly motivated, self-automated and driven.
Our culture
Our values of high ambition-always, customer in centre, getting it done together and being open and honest guide our everyday decisions and way of working. They are the guiding principles we expect everyone to act accordingly, and we believe that by living our values we will build a common, thriving culture.
Introduction to the Role
The Global Field Service Specialist – HPGR is a technical specialist position in the Global field service group primarily tasked with supporting the Grinding PL equipment for both Capital Plant and Services.
The Global Field Service Specialist - HPGR - is responsible for providing advisory services to Metso customers, Metso labour, and/or third-party contractors on existing or newly acquired equipment and components.
This position requires a talent for working with other people, fellow employees, customers, and contractors. Must be capable of making quick, accurate decisions relative to problem solution & problem liability.
Due to the extensive operational travel requirements of this global position candidates located in North & Central America, South America, Europe and Central Asia, Africa or Asia-Pacific are encouraged to apply.
Main Responsibilities
Prior to arrival at field assignment location, study, plan, and prepare for field work based on the detailed scope of work, drawings, specifications, Metso and customer policies/procedures/rules/regulations, specific instructions, etc.
Provide advisory service during installation, checkout, start-up, and commissioning to ensure safety and proper equipment and system erection by customer, customer's sub-contractor, Metso labour and/or Metso sub-contractor is in accordance with contract designs and drawing requirements.
Coordinate field activity with the customer, customer’s sub-contractor, Metso labor and/or Metso sub-contractor to maintain the specified schedule.
Make mechanical and process measurements and collect historical data on the equipment operation.
When appropriate, make recommendations to improve operational methods and/or efficiency.
Troubleshoot mechanical problems and advise on corrective action and repairs.
Keep the Project Manager, Field Service Manager and Engineering team up to date daily as necessary on-site progress, problems & delays.
Keep accurate records regarding job progress, delays, problems, deliveries, changes, extras, and engineering and fabrication errors.
Write, and timely submit, accurate, detailed technical reports of completed projects for submission to the customer and internal departments outlining the summary of the job, problems encountered, action(s) taken, future recommendations, and daily log.
Submit internal daily construction reports covering activity at the jobsite.
Document all job delays and their cause and ensure client comprehends and signs the documentation.
Communications with the client to ensure satisfaction with job progress and quality.
Insure client issues proper documentation for extra work and changes.
Ensure client signs time verification sheets for Metso and Metso subcontractor personnel prior to leaving site.
Ensure sub-contractors verify problems and provide proposals for re-work and extra work.
Perform training of the client's personnel in mechanical and/or electrical maintenance of the equipment.
Assist in the marketing of field service, retrofits, and spare parts.
Timely submission of accurate expense reports according to Metso travel policies and procedures.
Work in liaison with the various technical support staff within the Metso organization.
Recommend operating and maintenance procedures to insure proper function of equipment.
Train customer staff in proper methods to operate, maintain and repair the equipment.
Visit customers with the sales force to develop and grow service business opportunities.
When appropriate, deliver technical seminars to plant personnel in safely performing maintenance, repairs, and upgrade work.
Train other Metso Field Service Engineers and Field Service Technicians in the safe and proper methods and procedures to maintain and repair Metso equipment.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Field Service Manager and/or General Manager of Field Service.
Essential
Essential Qualifications & Skills
Associate degree, diploma or similar in the field of engineering or with relevant field experience of 5 years plus in millwright certification, automation, instrumentation, process, electrical or welding background etc.
3 years+ experience in sitework
Installation and Mechanical Commissioning of HPGR Grinding Equipment.
Ability to obtain international driver’s licence
Valid passport
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Excellent negotiation and persuasive skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent written & verbal English skills are essential
Desirable
Previous experience in HPGR equipment and systems,
Strong mechanical knowledge of associated pyro processes and procedures.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
APA Specific – Please note your regional benefits may differ slightly
Extensive learning opportunities - ongoing growth dialogues, internal mobility, mentoring programs, education assistance, ambitious projects, and global opportunities.
Wellbeing and safety - benefit from occupational healthcare, generous benefits plan, healthy living rewards, mental well-being services, and engagement surveys.
Annual bonus - global incentive programs tied to business and performance targets.
Hybrid working possibilities - while we are big advocates of meeting and collaborating in person, we believe in fostering a flexible work environment.
Worldwide support - leverage our network of peers across the world, offering valuable assistance. We get things done together, through open and honest communication.
A thriving culture – we are committed to developing an inclusive culture that enables everyone to do their best and reach their full potential. A culture that is courageous, compelling, and caring, and unites our people to build a sustainable future together.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority – both your physical and mental health is our priority
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Additional Annual Leave benefit - your health and wellbeing is a priority, increase your leave entitlement with every year you work at Metso.
Gender neutral parental leave - 18 weeks paid in full
Paid Volunteer Leave so you can give back to the local community or an organisation of your choice
Comprehensive medical benefits including discounted private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Novated lease - this benefit allows you to save on a new car and potentially enjoy significant tax savings
Various leisure benefits including discounted car rental and accommodation for leisure travel around the world.
Get in touch
Want to rise above the possible with us? Click ‘Apply now’ to leave your application.
How to join - Working at Metso - About Metso - Diversity and Inclusion - Meet our people
Metso is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, nationality, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with a disability.
Metso is a frontrunner in sustainable technologies, end-to-end solutions and services for the aggregates, minerals processing and metals refining industries globally. We improve our customers’ energy and water efficiency, increase their productivity, and reduce environmental risks with our product and service expertise. We are the partner for positive change.
Metso is headquartered in Espoo, Finland. At the end of 2024 Metso had close to 17,000 employees in around 50 countries, and sales in 2024 were about EUR 4.9 billion. Metso is listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki.
metso.com
Industries: Automation Machinery Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Machinery Manufacturing

职位介绍 岗位要求： 1.全日制本科及以上学历，行政管理、工商管理、英语等相关专业，具备良好的英语交流能力； 2.2年以上行政工作经验，具有良好的文字功底，熟练撰写发文、请示、函、会议纪要等公文以及各类方案； 3.精通Office办公软件，熟练运用word、ppt、excel等软件； 岗位工作： 1.负责公司行政、宣传、档案、合同、办公室6S、印章管理工作； 2.负责公司计划管理，做好计划的编制、报批及跟踪考核工作； 3.负责组织公司会议、活动，起草公司相关文件，公司企业文化建设工作； 4.协助公司各种管理规章制度的建立、修订及执行监督； 5.负责日常后勤保障、宿舍管理工作，提高员工满意度。 6.负责与集团和外部相关部门的联系、协调工作； 福利待遇：双休、法定节假日、五险一金、带薪年假、节假日福利、通勤班车、餐厅餐补等 其他信息 语言要求：英语 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

Title: Patent Paralegal (Permanent)
Description:
Leeds , Bath or Cardiff | Hybrid Working | Full-Time
Ready to level up your Paralegal career?
At EIP, we’re more than just a tier-one patent firm - we’re a team that celebrates curiosity, collaboration, and career development. You'll work alongside attorneys to drive the progress of client portfolios, applying your knowledge of IP procedures to manage tasks proactively and ensure deadlines are met. Your ability to manage processes confidently and efficiently will be key to your success.
What we’re looking for?
We’re looking for someone who’s proactive, organised, and ready to make an impact. You’ll bring:
Minimum 2+ years’ experience in a patent paralegal role
Completed the Introductory Patent Paralegal Course (IPPC)
Strong understanding of patent processes and procedures
Experience using Inprotech or similar patent databases
Familiarity with document management systems
Confident communication skills and a positive, can-do attitude
A collaborative mindset and keen attention to detail
What sets us apart?
EIP is an award-winning patent practice known for handling high-value, complex patent matters. With offices across the UK, Germany, Sweden, and the US, we combine global reach with a collaborative, forward-thinking culture where innovation, inclusion, and teamwork thrive.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including private medical insurance and flexible and hybrid working arrangements to support your wellbeing and work-life balance. We’re also deeply committed to diversity and inclusion - proud supporters of the IP Inclusive initiative and signatories to the IP Inclusive Charter.
Ready to Apply?
If you're passionate about patents and thrive in a fast-paced legal environment, we’d love to hear from you!

聊一聊
职位介绍 一、岗位职责 1、解决客户钻石飞机运行和维修中出现的各种技术问题； 2、给客户提供维修指导，按需协调资源，安排维修事宜； 3、分析客户机队技术问题，按需与设计机构、生产机构等相关方协调沟通； 4、处理客户的技术索赔事宜； 5、到客户现场进行调研、技术指导、协助排故、事件调查等。 二、基本条件 1、具有丰富的通航活塞类飞机维修和工程技术经验； 2、具备熟练的航空维修技能和航空技术文件查阅技能； 3、了解民航法规、通航市场； 4、书面语言能力好，英语听说读写能力好，沟通能力好，工作责任心强； 5、具有钻石飞机经验，民航维修执照，或英语流利者优先。 其他信息 语言要求：英语、普通话 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。
查看全部
猎聘温馨提示： 2. 如您应聘的岗位属于涉外劳务合作/海外岗位的，请务必核实招聘方对外劳务合作资质取得情况，同时注意自身资金安全，防范招聘欺诈。 了解更多安全防范知识> 查看全部
如您发现平台内招聘方存在以下违规行为的，请立即举报
a. 扣押您的身份证件或者其他证件；
b. 要求您提供担保人、担保金或者以其他名义向您收取财物（ 如培训费、体检费、资料费、置装费、押金等）；
c. 强迫您入股或者向您集资；
d. 以招聘名义牟取不正当利益；
e. 发布虚假招聘广告信息；
f. 工作时长违反劳动法规定；
g. 存在其他损害您的合法权益的行为。

公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

Title: Food Security Officer
Location: East London, South Africa Metropolitan Area
Description:
Apply now »
Date:
25 Dec 2025
Location:
Lalibela, Ethiopia
Company:
Plan International
The Organisation
Plan International is an independent development and humanitarian organisation that advances children’s rights and equality for girls. We believe in the power and potential of every child but know this is often suppressed by poverty, violence, exclusion and discrimination. And it is girls who are most affected.
Working together with children, young people, supporters and partners, we strive for a just world, tackling the root causes of the challenges girls and vulnerable children face. We support children’s rights from birth until they reach adulthood and we enable children to prepare for and respond to crises and adversity. We drive changes in practice and policy at local, national and global levels using our reach, experience and knowledge.
For over 85 years, we have rallied other determined optimists to transform the lives of all children in more than 80 countries.
We won’t stop until we are all equal.
The Opportunity
The position holder shall be in charge of planning, quality implementation and monitoring and reporting of the assigned Project Food Security and Livelihoods activities in the intervention area. The main purpose of the job is to implement emergency activities of BRAVE Humanitarian Program Ministry for Finland Foreign Affairs (MFA) funded project that will be implemented in the Lasta woreda of Amhara region.
The Individual
BSc in Food Security, Crop Production and Agronomy Disaster Risk Management, Agricultural Extension, Rural Development, Agricultural Economics, Development Economics, Agribusiness Management, Development studies, Sociology or other related fields is required with a minimum of 3 years of related working experience.
Equipped with sufficient level of awareness on: Early warning concepts; agriculture, Disaster risk management practice and knowhow; integrated WASH, food security and livelihoods framework and Gender, nutrition-sensitive food security program.
Knowledge of Plan policies and procedures, Sphere and the Red Cross/ NGO Code of Conduct
Knowledge of child rights programming
Good knowledge of field level realities of humanitarian NGOs work;
Knowledge of FSL, CTP (cash and voucher assistance), Agriculture, EWS, DRR and DCM;
Good understanding of the external operating environment including government policies, strategies, guidelines and operating procedures in managing emergencies and disasters in the country Perform multiple, non-technical tasks with a potential need to upgrade skills in order to meet changing job conditions.
Please Click Here To Review The Full Job Description
Safeguarding Children and Program Participants (Safeguarding) and Gender Equality and Inclusion (GEI)
Understands and puts into practice the responsibilities under Safeguarding and GEI policies and Plan International’s Code of Conduct (CoC), ensuring that concerns are reported and managed per the appropriate procedures.
Ensures that all staff in the unit/function/department are properly inducted on and understand their role in upholding Plan International’s safeguarding and GEI policies;
Ensures that Plan International’s global policies for Safeguarding Children and Young People and Gender Equality and Inclusion are fully embedded in day-to-day work.
Ensures that Plan Ethiopia contributes to Plan International’s global efforts to ensure safeguarding and GEI, including making sure that relevant reporting and data are submitted.
Location: Lalibela
Type of Role: BRAVE Project until December 31, 2026
Reports to: Project Coordinator
Grade: C1
Closing Date: December 30, 2025
Equality, diversity and inclusion is at the very heart of everything that Plan International stands for.
We want Plan International to reflect the diversity of the communities we work with, offering equal opportunities to everyone regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.
Plan International is based on a culture of inclusivity and we strive to create a workplace environment that ensures every team, in every office, in every country, is rich in diverse people, thoughts, and ideas.
We foster an organisational culture that embraces our commitment to racial justice, gender equality, girls’ rights and inclusion.
Plan International believes that in a world where children face so many threats of harm, it is our duty to ensure that we, as an organisation, do everything we can to keep children safe. This means that we have particular responsibilities to children that we come into contact with and we must not contribute in any way to harming or placing children at risk.
A range of pre-employment checks will be undertaken in conformity with Plan International's Safeguarding Children and Young People policy. Plan International also participates in the Inter Agency Misconduct Disclosure Scheme. In line with this scheme we will request information from applicants previous employers about any findings of sexual exploitation, sexual abuse and/or sexual harassment during employment, or incidents under investigation when the applicant left employment. By submitting an application, the job applicant confirms their understanding of these recruitment procedures.
Please note that Plan International will never send unsolicited emails requesting payment from candidates.

职位介绍 岗位职责: 1.寻找和订购用于对现有体系持续改进的资本性设备，刀具以及设备，包括现有的库存项目和新制造的组件(发运的集装箱/扣件) 2.与供应商紧密合作确保产品准时发运并且符合规格3.对现有设备的持续改进 4.参加有关加工和装配设备的会议，计划，接收审批，完成布局，拜访供应商 5.作为与客户的联络者确保在设备和其他采购上的足够的沟通 6.解决或纠正故障或不能持续生产的设备和系统 任职资格: 1.本科及以上学历 2.良好的项目管理经验 3.4轴CNC编程，尤其是FANUC控制 4.R&R和CPK计算及机加工运行，夹具设计 5.工程学历背景，3-5 年的制造经验 其他信息 语言要求：英语、普通话 行业要求：汽车零部件及配件
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。
